The consistent quality of the espresso is high and together with the convenience, it's a winner for all but the snootiest (for whom, nothing but their own "recipe" will have been satisfactory anyway).

Text: good espresso
column5: makes a great latte, quick and easy to use .  if you visit illy's website you will find that it is cheaper to buy illy coffee on amazon

Text: Fast and easy
column5: These pods make the preparing of deliciouse espresso, capuccino and late much easier, faster and cleaner.

Text: Great..  Best pods
column5: For pod espresso, these are the best.  They make a great cup when I dont want to heat up my Ms. Silvia and grind.

Text: Good But TOO Pricey
column5: I spend a lot of time making lattes and I've used Starbucks, illy, and Lavazza pods all ordered on Amazon. Right now illy is $.88 a pod, Lavazza is $.525 a pod, and Starbucks is $.4125 a pod. Which actually suprised me. illy pods take about half the time Starbucks pods take, I think this is because the grounds are not as tightly packed. With illy and Lavazza I have had a couple pods break, or water leak out of my machine, found out it was due to the extra little grip lip on the pod itself so after I cut those off no more leaking. I actually enjoy the taste of illy over Starbucks but in these times where money is tight. I'll stick with the Star-"bucks" to save a few.

Text: Absolutely love this coffee
column5: I look forward to this coffee every morning.  It is much like the coffee they serve in Europe - rich and strong.  If you like the typical American weak and watery coffee you would not like it but if you long for the coffee you experience in Europe you would be thrilled.

Text: convenient.. but worth the price???
column5: On average my wife an I drink 1-2 expressos daily and a few months ago bought a delonghi bar32 expresso maker. I purchased this product just to see what all the hype was. It seemed from people I talked with and some reviews that some people really think this is a great tasting product. After going through the 2 boxes I can say it does taste good, but I still prefer fresh ground. It is hard to explain, but these pods had a distinct taste, not like the fresh ground I make or what you would expect at Starbucks. The taste isn't bad, just distinctly different, which may be what people that rate it high like. For me I enjoyed the convenience of the pods, but wouldn't regurally pay extra for the taste.

Text: Excellent pods and good for free shipping
column5: My wife loves these pods for her quick and easy twice a day espresso hit.  And I love them because, unlike how we used to buy them in units of ten boxes, here I can get two boxes at a time, which means that whenever I want to buy something for less than $25 I just toss this into the order and can get free shipping anytime.  Since she uses about a box a week, and I don't order more than once weekly, it works out perfectly.  And the coffee is excellent coffee if you like a dark roast pod.

Text: A Shot a day keeps me working away
column5: Great shot in a dirty chai, use in handpresso, handy, portable, consistent shot of joe!

Text: Awful
column5: This has to be the worse Espresso coffee I ever tried.  If you think it's good, you've never been to a Starbiucks to try their Express.

Text: Best-in-class For ESE Pods
column5: Because of time constraints in the morning, I've been trying different ESE pods. These blew me away! Maybe I got a fresh batch, but I am having a tough time distinguishing these from my fresh ground beans. Rich, flavorful and lots of crema. Very robusto. Makes a superb latte!  Stands up well in the the steamed milk. Price-wise, I save a bit vs. stopping for a grande Starbucks latte and get a much better flavor. One tip: I read this in another review, and I'll confirm that dampening the pod before use works well for me for the best seal and pull. Regarding some of the comparisons to Starbucks in other reviews, I've tried both @ home, and to me the Starbucks doesn't come close.

Text: Love it!
column5: We order this product all the time for the office.  We put a splash of Hazelnut creamer and it is AMAZING!

Text: Overpriced
column5: I'm not a gourmet, just someone who looks forward to her morning latte. I typically make a 12-oz latte with a single shot. I like saving money by making my own lattes, but don't want to take the time or deal with the mess of grinding beans, so I prefer pods. I recently bought a De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker, and was inspired to expand my horizons beyond Starbucks espresso pods, so I tried a few different brands. Given the price, I expected these to be very good, but was unimpressed. The taste is not significantly less bitter than Starbucks, and the aroma less appetizing. They do give a good pull in my machine, but to me are not worth the price premium. These are E.S.E espresso pods, made for espresso machines with E.S.E pod adapters. They are not for Senseo or K-cups machines.

Text: Prompt arrival as promised
column5: Our order arrived very promptly and the E.S.E. pods make a quick, easy, and smooth espresso in our Saeco Aroma Espresso machine.  Each pod only makes a single espresso so don't try to stretch it.

Text: Strong full-bodied taste. Best ESE pods in the market.
column5: I'm an espresso lover. Most ESE pods don't taste like the authentic Italian espresso that's extracted the traditional way. illy Caffe Scura pods is the closest you can get to an actual espresso shot. I love it's strong full-bodied taste. For me, this is the best ESE pods I've ever tried.

Text: illy dark roast, blank band
column5: Package came in as dated. The coffee is excellent. I actually prefer illy's medium roast and thought i'd try something new. If you love dark roast, this is a perfect choice.

Text: Nice and clean
column5: They make it easy on you with this bags but it is a bit pricey compared to the same coffe from the can!  Good coffe taste though!

Text: Superb espresso
column5: illy makes a great product, possibly the best. Can't go wrong with these pods. Thank you illy, don't ever change!

Text: Great Coffee
column5: Illy pods produce excellent coffee without the mess of ground coffee. The Dark Roast is highly fragrant, and strong but not bitter. I tried the Starbucks and Lavazza pods, but these are better.

Text: I love illy
column5: Been trying various pods to make espresso, but this stuff can't be beat.  Just about perfect.  I like the dark roast best, but the medium is great too.  Slightly more expensive than most, but absolutely worth it.

Text: Excellent coffee, super easy to use!
column5: We have the Francis Francis X6 and it, and this coffee, are really awesome. Couldn't be easier and better tasting!

Text: Convenient, nice crema, and distinct taste
column5: When I bought my espresso-cap machine (Delonghi 32), i was expecting to blend my own espresso grinds, experimenting with flavor and taste. Then I had a kid and that whole idea went out the door. Heck, I don't even buy coffee beans anymore. The Illy pods are extremely convenient, and provide a distinct smooth taste that I don't get at say Starbucks or some Italian restaurants around here that make their own espresso. I like the flavor. Not too strong, like say Starbucks, but not weak other. Has a little sweetness to it, strangely, and that could be just my taste buds. I don't like the price, but too be honest, I've already done "the save and subscribe" and am on my 2nd shipment. Look: it's convenient, and as a new dad who needs an extra kick here and there, well - this does the job.

Text: Like being back in Italy
column5: The Illy is the best commercial Italian coffe that you can find not only in the USA but in Italy too. It is pricy but it is really worth all the money that you spend on it. Illy has a smooth velvet-like taste that roll on your tongue. The smell is sooting and relaxing, but is strong enough to weak you up no matter how sleepy you feel. I highly raccomand it to everyone, because if you like coffe you can't help but love it, and if you don't like coffe, you will love Illy anyway. It's just too god.

Text: Illy espresso
column5: We've been using the Illy packets since buying our small espresso maker over a year ago, and we had been fairly satisfied with the results. At least they were consistent, and we didn't have to clean up coffee grounds. However, despite the added mess of using beans the results we get by using freshly ground coffee in our inexpensive mill produce a somewhat better flavor, depending on the roast, etc. that we buy. We're sticking with beans now.

Text: ILLY
column5: My husband and I use these everyday, love that it comes in a 2pack! Would be even better if i could buy a box of 50-100.

Text: Completely my fault
column5: Completely my fault for not reading thoroughly.  I put in a search for Nespresso pods and these pulled up.  Even though I love illy brand I cannot use them in my Nespresso machine.  They are round filter pods.  The description wasn't very clear to me so I'm stuck with them as they are not returnable.

Text: Delicious
column5: I am a repeat customer. I don't drink coffee but my husband and daughter love this product. It cannot be found in stores.

Text: Better product description, please!
column5: If there had been more information about these olives I could have chosen better. I love the Ionian green olives so I tried another Peloponnese product. I think this is an excellent company, the olives are meaty and attractive, but I don't like olives with a bunch of dried herbs flavoring them. To their credit, that flavor is not as heavy handed as some. Oregano just seems to get stronger and stronger, and to me, very objectionable. I'm going to get some more Ionian Greens - unflavored, straight up olives. I'm sure there's room in the refrigerator for 10 pounds of olives .

Text: VDriscoll
column5: This is a product that I buy 5 jars at a time at my local grocers.  It costs much less to buy in bulk and the product is of equal quality.  One word of caution, have a plan for storage as the bag is not resealable.

Text: Never again
column5: If you are ever tempted to buy Peloponnese country olives because Byzantine country olives are not available, I have a word of advice: don't. In fact, I would say more generally, don't ever. The problem for me is twofold. One, they are mushy, never firm. Two, they are in a briny water that is heavily flavored with herbs, primarily oregano I think, which gives them a very salty, pungent and unpleasant taste. What is worse is that they all taste the same, when they are supposed to be a mix. I would never buy them again.

Text: Good Olives
column5: We have purchased these many times, & also sent them as gifts. They are very tasty but now that the price has gone sky high we will be savoring our last bag.  (UPDATE) Ordered these for xmas 2010 despite the price increase & they were terrible, soggy to the point of being almost rotten. I won't ever buy these again, such a shame, when they were good, they were very good.

Text: Nice variety and good price for olives
column5: This is a very good assortment( some large, some small, some black, some green). Our shipment arrived with minimal damage to the olives.  The taste is good.  We drain the olives add a pierced jalapeno pepper or two to a jar and then fill to completely cover the olives with good quality olive oil.  Olives prepared this way are not refrigerated and will keep for months. Just place them on your counter top away from direct sunlight or in the pantry and enjoy. After the olives are gone you can use the flavored olive oil for cooking.  This is a particularly good value when you sign up for a regular subscription ( comes to about $6/ per pound).  We eat lots of olives so this is a good deal for us. I also find a jar of olives to be a good hostess gift for friends.

Text: If you like whole olives, I recommend these.
column5: These olives are a blend of Kalamata, Ionian Green and other types.  The quality is fine and they taste great.  The blend is typical of those found in olive bars in supermarkets like Wegmans in the NE but at about 2/3rds the cost.  If you are looking for mixed whole Greek olives and can use 5 lbs within 1 months time from opening,this is the best deal you are likely to find.

Text: a Christmas present for my husband!!
column5: These olives are just wonderful.  My husband thinks of excuses to eat them.  Our Greek neighbor also says they are great!!  Like the different choices of olives.

Text: quality bulk olives
column5: I enjoyed bulk olives. I really appreciate getting fresh bulk olives that other people have not had the opportunity to contaminate in grocery stores bulk olive bins.

Text: Oreo Treat
column5: I purchase this item by the case because it is so very very difficult to find in Japan. I make it for my students and they all know Oreo cookies. I top it  with some bananas and they think I am a master chef. Yeah!

Text: amazing!
column5: Love this especially with mint. Highly recommended! Love the new boxed kit they have to but I use real whipped cream instead of cool whip.

Text: Yum Yum
column5: Of all the flavors these are avilable in, these are my favorites.  Just the right balance of peanut and ginger with some small peanut pieces.

Text: TOOO  GREAT to pass up  and nutritious too
column5: These little gems are the best  as long as you can do peanuts  you will want to purchase the bulk as the little bags are just not enough Great to have with you

Text: Ginger People Peanut-Ginger chews
column5: Obsessed with these candies - good for my stomach too!  Once you have one, you eat like 20!!!!!  Awesome

Text: "Long lasting" - not so much
column5: First off, I have to give kudos to Rachael Ray for making products without byproducts and artificial colors. I have a 4 year old pug who loves anything rawhide but has some allergy problems, so I've been trying out other products to see what can fit her needs. She is currently gnawing on the last of the 3 chews that came in the pack I bought (all this flavor) - the "soup bones" smell pretty tasty, and she appears to love them, but my chief complaint is that these bones are supposedly "long lasting". I gave my pug the soup bone 1 minute before I started typing, and without taking any breaks from where I am currently typing at (about 2 minutes into this review), the bone is 3/4 gone. Knowing her, and the noises I'm hearing, she's demolishing that last quarter, putting it at roughly a 4 minute treat. To me, that is not very lengthy of time. TL;DR: This product will last roughly 4 minutes in the mouth of any dog that has ever had more than 25 rawhides in their life; probably tastes good, no splintering (as promised).

Text: World's Best Mustard (but not for krautdogs)
column5: We have found this stuff off and on for the last 20 years.  We use it for an awful lot of stuff, when we can get it: Hamburgers, Meat Fondue, pork, chicken, sauces, etc.  This spring I planted tarragon and was going to make it myself with a Dijon, because our local gourmet food store stopped carrying it. Amazon to the rescue.  Wouldn't use it on a hotdog or egg roll though.

Text: love this tea!
column5: There are very few teas that I love.  This is one of them.  The other tea company that I love is Lupicia.  There is something sooo balanced and smooth about this tea.  Once you've tried this blend, it makes it impossible to enjoy normal tea bags sold at grocery stores such as twinings and even the teas that are sold at Starbucks.

Text: Just try it
column5: Many vocal critics of illy coffee have never actually tasted it. As Dr. House says, everybody lies and illy is apparently a very popular thing to lie about. I've caught several vocal critics lying about illy (by serving it to them, getting the typical "This is fabulous!" reaction, then telling them what they're drinking. You know, the Folger's Coffee Crystals technique). Why is this? Well, on the surface illy does appear to be frivolous and therefore an easy target. - It's very expensive, especially for coffee that comes in a can  - It's got a very fussy, very European marketing envelope around it  - It tends to be sold in fussy, trendy stores  - Because it's roasted and packaged in Italy, it is always several months old when you buy it  - Did I mention that it's very expensive? As a result, it's easy to dismiss illy as an elitist, "image" product that can't possibly be worth what it costs. And it's easy to convince others of the same thing, whether you've actually tried illy or not. The truth is illy is really superb coffee, just about the best I've ever tried. Since I've started drinking it at home, I've found I'm actually drinking much less coffee overall, because I only know a couple of places that serve illy locally and I just don't feel like bothering with anything else, at least most of the time. The ironic net effect of this is that illy may actually be saving me some money! I don't know if illy will be worth what it costs to you. There are some very good coffee beans sold by Costco for roughly 1/5 the price, much better than anything you can get at Starbucks or Peets. (In fact, if Starbucks or Peets is your idea of really good coffee, stop reading this now. Not because I think you're some tasteless boob, but because those brands are in the very modern, very successful mode of bitter, over-roasted, burned-tasting American coffee and I don't personally care for that. So if you like those brands, you're probably not going to like illy or any coffee that I like. Personally, I like the bottomless cup of Peerless my favorite diner serves much better than Starbucks.) What I do know is that if you like coffee enough to own a decent grinder and other caffeine paraphernalia, you really ought to try illy. In particular, if you like light-medium roasts but find most are just too wimpy, you may just love this stuff. If not, you'll at least have a cute, fussy  little can you can sub-divide some of your Costco walnuts into. And that is something.

Text: consistent high quality
column5: Illy espresso beans are my favorite of all the widely available commercially produced roasted espresso beans. This is the standard medium roast that Illy produces and it is a bit less aggressive and milder tasting than the dark roasts of Lavazza (the other major Italian brand that some people favor). When properly ground, tamped, and brewed Illy espresso has a delightful aroma and flavor, unmatched by any of the other brands. Granted, Illy is quite pricey, and I do not use it all the time for this reason. However, you get what you pay for. Usually, I buy my espresso from a small roasting house in the Midwest that produces a decent medium roast substitute that I do not mind using most of the time. But Illy definitely produces a higher quality bean. One way to judge the quality of roasted espresso beans even before you taste the coffee that they will produce is to look at the evenness of color and size of the beans. The reason is that beans of a uniform size tend to roast more evenly than beans of varying sizes. Moreover, even when the beans are of a uniform size, it is important that they be roasted in small batches and churned during the the entire roasting process to ensure that they all get roasted to the same point. This is why most high quality coffee is roasted in small batches in a rotating drum that roasts all the beans to the exact same point. Moreover, since the moisture content of the beans varies a bit from batch to batch, quality control in the roasting process is extremely important. And it is here that Illy is unmatched. Just do a simple visual comparison of the color and consisteny of Illy beans when compared to any of the other widely available brands and you can easily see why Illy is the best.

Text: illy Caffe Normale Whole Bean (Red Top) Coffee, 8.8 Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
column5: Fancy coffee packaging. The quality of beans is very good. The reason for 3 stars is the price. I find Lavazza Tierra which %100 Arabica like Illy has the same quality or better for a fraction of the price of Illy beans.

Text: Best vacuum-sealed beans if you can't get fresher
column5: My adventure with coffee started years ago; I've been through a Jura-Capresso S9 (Super-automatic) and eventually found my way to a Rancillio Silvia V3 espresso machine. My hunt for good beans (Tucson, AZ) has been as variable, eventually being able to find decent fresh-ish beans at the local Whole Foods-type-place (Sunflower). Of all the mail-order, vacuum-sealed, "older" beans I've tried (including any main-stream beans like Milestone) from a super market, these Illy are much better, but compared to real, fresh beans, they don't quite stand up. Taste-wise these beans are much smoother than I expected; because they are vacuum-sealed and typically 2-4months old by the time you get them, I expected the dry/sharp/bitter taste that I get from every other bean I've tried (you ever tried Starbucks beans? Good lord, bitter) and was surprised when they actually ended up being quite a bit smoother. The smell during grinding is a typical "dry/old" bean smell, it doesn't have that lustrous smell that a fresh bean does and when pulling the shot it doesn't have that carmel-colored, never-ending crema that a fresh bean gives, but surprisingly enough, it tastes pretty nice. At my Whole Foods-esque store, I can get fresh-ish beans for $7.99/lb, at roughly $36/lb it is *impossible* for me to justify these Illy beans. If you are in a location where fresh-beans are an impossibility and you have been relegated to super-market, main-stream garbage beans, and you don't mind paying the premium, these beans are quite nice and should keep you pretty happy. If you are a bean-snob and demand perfect behavior of your beans through the grind/shot sequence, then you probably need to keep looking and need to move somewhere where fresh coffee is more readily found :)

Text: Way better than Starbucks
column5: I've been drinking espresso since 1983 when I was introduced to it by Signor Forza in Rome. I found out that Italians have a saying "Only women and babies drink cappucino after 9:00". What that means is that all the men take a coffee (espresso) break at 9:00. Well since I returned to the states in 1985 I have tried all kinds of expresso beans, using mostly Starbucks. I happened across a can of Illy beans at a Tucson store. I vaguely remembered the Illy brand from my 8 months in Italy and decided to try it. It is inarguably the best espresso I have had since returning from Italy.

Text: My favorite coffee
column5: This is my favorite coffee!  I don't drink it every day because it is a bit pricey, but whenever I have guests, I serve them illy it is nice to let them feel special that I am sharing this treat with them.  It is very smooth without leaving an acidy taste in your mouth like drinking a desert.  I would recommend it to anyone who wants a nice smooth cup of coffee.  They don't burn their beans!

Text: Simply great coffe beans!!!!
column5: I have had esspresso from here to china in many different shops.  I know my coffee and espresso.  As coffee is a very personal prefrence take this for what it may.  There is no bitterness (though some skill is needed in making it) the flavor is rich, smooth, and consistent.  that is where illy is a step ahead of others.  Notice the consistent bean size in an Illy can.  this leads to constent roasting of the beans.  This leads to constent flavor.  Weather you prefer a dark roast or a medium the bean size uniformity is key to the roasting and processing steps of the process.  a good analogy is does angel hair pasta need to boil for as long as a thick ziti.  No if you did the angel hair would be mush by the time the ziti was done.  Well cofee beans can be over or under done for the same reason thickness and size drive rates. One thing I would say to some one concered about the price.  For 16 dollars I get a week of espresso's.  I used to spend this in D&D or starbuck in 2 days, and it was not as good! If you really enjoy your coffee you should give it a try, if you still really like starbucks after that I would be shocked!!!  It would be a challange for me to go to starbucks again unless I am in an airport and no where serves Illy! For me it is well worth it

Text: Always a good choice
column5: Illy brand has always been one of my favorite beans.  The price is comparable to grocery stores.  It didn't matter much to me but the tin was smashed/dented a bit on every can. The beans were unharmed.

Text: best coffee on the planet
column5: Having drunk a bit of coffee and done some experimentation at home with our own grinder and espresso machine, we always come back to Illy.  Can't go past it, perfect every time.

Text: Espresso perfection
column5: I make espresso with a Delonghi Magnifica Super Auto Espresso machine and I have found Illy Medium Roast to produce the best results possible.  It's a little more expensive than buying beans locally but the difference is astounding.

Text: Not close to Kicking Horse
column5: I bought a can of Illy whole bean coffee, hearing so many wonderful things about it. The beans are good, flavor decent, rarely bitter but didn't find anything truly special about the coffee. Bought a can of Kicking Horse 454 to compare. The beans are very oily and aroma far more overpowering than the Illy. It may be too strong but it was clear that these beans were very fresh and full bodied. While 454 is a dark roast, even the medium roasts seem to have the same experience. One of my friends called Illy "airport coffee" and while I think it's a cut above the cheap, I'm not sure I disagree with him. I certainly think Peet's is better than Illy. Perhaps it's meant for espresso machines, I don't know. But at this price, I don't think it's worth it. Everything is a matter of taste, of course, but if you get a chance to look at the beans from other brands, you might be surprised. I certainly was.

Text: delicious coffee
column5: I use this coffee in my fully automatic coffee machine. The result is just as tasty as what I can buy at a commercial coffee house.

Text: Very disappointed!
column5: I found this coffee bean, freshly coarse-ground in a burr grinder and carefully prepared in a French press, to be devoid of aroma and very bitter, even with sugar (which I ordinarily do not add) added. Wish it could be returned for a refund of its unreasonable cost, but it cannot be.

Text: Smooth .
column5: Great product with a very smooth taste! One reminder.. the instructions on the can are for 5oz cups, you may have to adjust the amount of coffee used depending on your taste and the size cup measure on your coffee maker.

Text: Excellent Coffee
column5: The beans are consistently roasted just right to produce the same high-quality cup of coffee from can to can.  My only complaint is the price, but I guess you get what you pay for.

Text: The best coffee ever!
column5: This coffee is delish - I dump this into my Jura Capresso coffee maker and it makes the most smooth, mellow, almost chocolaty tasting coffee (never bitter or harsh).  Yumm!

Text: My favorite daily coffee
column5: This is a nice mild blend that I use for my daily morning coffee. It works well in a fully automatic Capresso machine, the beans are not oily at all. I use subscribe and save feature to get this coffee at a great price.

Text: Good Coffee
column5: We purchased this with our super-automatic espresso machine. Very good brew, it is a bit expensive, but has great flavor. The cans are good for storing any coffee (we often get 3lb bags and use the cans for storing for daily use).

Text: very good flavor but at such a price
column5: Ok, I'd heard people rave and I had to try it. I grind my beans in a burr grinder, and I brew the coffee in a drip machine with a cone style filter. First, I followed the instructions on the can, and I found the coffee too weak.  At 25% stronger, the flavor was fine, but surely no better than some at half the price.  Nice can, though!

Text: Bad condition!
column5: I bought these to go into gift baskets and the cans are ALL dented. Not very nice presentation. I will stick with local supplier where I can inspect the product.

Text: Great Tasting Sugar-Free Pudding! Highly Recommended
column5: Jell-O "Sugar-Free Instant Pudding" is a great snack! Since becoming a Type 2 diabetic last year, I am always looking for good tasting, low carb snacks. The Jell-O instant puddings are easy to make and taste so good that it is hard to tell it is a "diet" snack. Highly recommended!

Text: Ordered 1.5 ounce Received 1.0 ounce
column5: The product is great.  I use it as my snack food because it is sugar free and a good way for me to "drink" more milk.  HOWEVER:  I ordered a 24-pack of 1.5 ounce boxes.  I received 1.0 ounce boxes.  Amazon replaced the order with another carton of 1.0 ounce boxes.  I would have preferred to have received what I ordered.  Still love the product.

Text: Great Product, but Amazon's warehouse is messed up
column5: The product, as listed, is a CASE of 24, 1.5 ounce boxes of pudding mix.  Imagine my surprise when I opened the box to find ONE box (1.5 ounce, 6 servings) instead of the expected 24.  This leads to a call to Amazon with a customer service representative who unfortunately didn't know what Jell-O pudding was and was having a hard time understanding that there had been an error in the number of items shipped.  Ummmm   who would pay $30 for six 1/2 cup servings of pudding???  This was finally understood and another order was placed (kindly, they did not require me to return the single box of pudding).  Low and behold, several days later the package arrives  AGAIN another single box of pudding instead of a case of 24 boxes.  Another phone call to Amazon, another rep who doesn't quite understand but finally decides to just credit me for the order and not require that I return the single package.  It was decided that we would not try to place the order again, as it would appear the warehouse has a problem filling orders for this item.  I orderd the chocolate flavor case of 24 and it arrived without problem  a carton of 24 boxes of pudding mix, as expected.

Text: Picky turkey junky cat turned it down.
column5: I was surprised when my turkey junky turned this one down.  He's loved most of the other varieties in this series and well, this one just didn't make the grade.  Had to flush it down the garbage disposal so the rest went back to the store for the egg souffles'.  Gotta love that finicky part, huh?  Anyway, I do recommend it anyway because of their high nutritional value.  My rescue Persian cannot eat these shredded varieties because her previous owner kicked out her teeth on one side of her mouth.  She doesn't care much for turkey anyway but I was disappointed that she couldn't chew these because of their high nutritional value.  Gets tiring cutting up all that cat food! Recommend but with the above experience.

Text: My Cat Loves It!
column5: My cat loves this product. I only give her half a can at a time considering how pricey it is but I found that the stuff is pretty rich so she doesn't really finish a whole can at a time. She's really picky about what she eats but every flavor of this has proven to be really great for her. I suggest this to anyone who has picky cats. :)

Text: Delicious
column5: A quick, easy and delicious option for dinner. Slice it up, cover in sauce and sliced mozzarella, put into a 350 degree oven until bubbly  wonderful.

Text: The best Tandoori mix on the market
column5: I have tried many other Tandoori mixes, this by far exceeds all the rest. I use it with buttermilk marinated for 24 hours.

Text: Tandoori Chicken
column5: Does a great job, just add to yogurt.  I accidentally used French Vanilla yogurt and it was still good.  I think plain yogurt is best.

Text: Tandoori Made Easy
column5: My husband is in love with Tandoori chicken and I bought this to make it at home.  It is a homerun every night I use it, and I experimented with it on beef in the crockpot, CULINARY MASTERPIECE.  Super easy to use, open packet, add yogurt, mix, and cook.  Perfection everytime.

Text: Tasty, easy to use and good value
column5: I am a huge fan of tandoori chicken and wanted to try my hand at making some at home.  I looked online and found this product with good reviews.  I am glad that I bought it because it is certainly tasty.  It was easy to use, and I made it for some friends and they loved it, too.  I think for the money this product is a good value. If you like tandoori and want to make it at home, I strongly recommend this spice. I would definitely buy this again.

Text: Outstanding
column5: I used alot more yogurt than called for, and it is a tart Bulgarian yogurt. I use boneless/skinless chicken thighs whole in a 13X9 baking dish in a 325 oven for one hour. Makes a great sauce with which to top rice. This is my favorite of all the India spices from Curry Tree.

Text: Good Deal
column5: We go through this dressing very quickly.  It is delicious and easy to fix.  Got the 24 pack at a good price, cheaper than the grocery store (which only sells 4 packs), and enough to last for a while.

Text: good seasons salad dressing
column5: Product was received in good shape. The problem is that there was little packaging of the individual packets, and no date of manufacture nor "best used by" date--which leaves one wondering if this is a way of dumping outdated stock. DISAPPOINTED!!!

Text: My sister in law's favorite salad addition
column5: My sister in law loves Good Seasons dry Italian salad dressing.  Whenever I visit her in Israel it is the first thing I pack for her.  She makes the most delicious dressing with it and has given her daughter in laws the recipe so now they want me to bring packets as well!

Text: Addicted to this stuff
column5: We love this salad dressing at our house.  I make it with olive oil and balsamic vinegar with a splash of apple cider vinegar.  I've turned scores of people onto this dressing.  One friend said her husband liked it so much, he practically drinks it.  The Amazon price (24 packs) is about a third the price compared to the grocery store. Highly recommended.

Text: Really the best.
column5: Illy is the perfect espresso blend for people who haven't invested in a $600 burr grinder. Instead of trying to describe its qualities, let me relate a story: This summer we went on a houseboat vacation where I was subjected to God-awful drip coffee for a week.  As soon as we got off the boat I hit up a  Starbucks, which was of course disappointing.  Then, when I got home, we were out of Illy. On Monday morning I tried to make my espresso with some of Trader Joe's Espresso Blend, and while I love the Trader's, their espresso is horrible.  Finally at lunchtime I was able to find some Illy.  I was so thrilled that on the way home from work I had to pop the top, just to smell its deliciousness.  When I finally got home and pulled myself a shot, I was in heaven. It's like an addiction, a craving.  And in 6 months of searching since I got my espresso machine, I haven't found better nationally available coffee.

Text: Illy Espresso has smooth taste
column5: We love the taste of Illy coffees when brewed in our espresso machine-- smooth, never bitter. And the vacuum-packed canister has a unique, reusable design.

Text: Nonpareil
column5: I've been brewing espresso at home for over 25 years, and have tried just about everything (including lugging suitcases full of coffee from Italy).  This coffee is indeed superior to everything else.  What's interesting is that the coffee is ground perfectly for espresso machines, so I'm saved the chore and mess of grinding my own. For some reason, the chief competitor, Lavazza, although selling decent coffee, for less than half the price, does not grind it optimally, forcing me to buy their beans and grind them myself.  Illy is expensive, at least double the runner-up. But then you could argue, that 45 cents a cup, instead of 20 cents, amounts to less than a dollar per day difference (assuming 4 cups per day), an amount you could afford spoiling yourself. Unfortunately, Amazon's price is even higher than our local supermarkets (Safeway, Giant, etc) where it's sold for $12.99 a can.  You could save 15% by subscribing, but then you could stock up locally when it's on sale.

Text: Deeeeeelicious!
column5: Illy makes the best espresso roast coffee. I don't usually buy ground coffee, but this is great for my rushed mornings. Works perfect with a Bialetti stove top espresso/cappuccino maker. Bialetti Mukka Express Cappuccino Maker, Polished Aluminum

Text: The perfect cup of espresso to jump start your day
column5: After purchasing a Gaggia 16103 Evolution Espresso Machine, Silver several years ago, I started hunting for the perfect Italian espresso roast. One of my first (and favorite) blends was the Illy Fine Grind Dark Roast. Imported from Italy, Illy is available in whole beans, drip grind (for regular coffeemakers), espresso grind, and pods. When I took the Illy for a test drive, it produced an espresso with an assertive crema, something that cheaper brands such as Alessi and Lavazza did not. The beans themselves are roasted to perfection, with a caramel-like odor and nuance of flavor that I've yet to match in cheaper blends. I don't consume espresso straight, but instead whip up divine lattes using Illy Fine Grind Dark Roast as the base, although the Illy has so many rich notes, it would probably be great solo. I live in a large metro area, so there are numerous stores that carry Illy, but if you live in a small town, you may have to mail order yours. Another plus is the fact that it comes in an airtight tin perfect for storing in the freezer (as ground coffee tends to go stale quickly). Yes, this is expensive, but still cheaper than purchasing a burr grinder to grind my own espresso beans (when I pondered buying whole Illy beans and priced a burr grinder, my estimates were between $150-400). Illy also makes a fabulous decaf blend in dark roast (ILLY Ground Decaf Coffee 00493) that runs several dollars more, but is perfect for those late-night espresso indulgences. If you're thinking that it's too expensive, consider that a venti latte at Starbucks will set you back about $5 for ONE coffee, versus at least a dozen from a can of really great Italian coffee.

Text: Probably the best between commercial ones
column5: I want to review this product because I think there are some misunderstanding on what you should expect from it. First thing: Illy is one of the most appreciated brands in Italy, between those you find in supermarket shelves. Definitely not THE BEST, since in my country you can easily have imported beans roasted and ground at the moment.  Second: It is NOT for use in auto dripping machines. The type of grinding is too thin. American coffee is made with coarse grind. This is to be used with espresso machines, or "caffettiera", amongst which Bialetti is the best brand, or pressure steam machines, those you find at the coffe shops.  Third: to all of you who say "it's bitter": just put sugar in it, in Italy we put sugar in espresso. If you don't use sugar it is SUPPOSED to be bitter. To all of you who say it doesn't give you the "caffeine shot": that's not what espresso is for. If you need caffeine and need to wake up drink one of those energy drinks you can find at every store across the USA. Or just take some day off, sleep more and work less, like we do in Italy. Espresso is something small and enjoyable that makes your life a little better. Therefore it has to be good. It's part of our culture to enjoy the small things and try to live happier.

Text: Try your local grocer for a better price
column5: Marvelous coffee with a smooth, rich flavor and no bitter taste when made with an Alessi Richard Sapper stovetop machine. BUT, the price here is *way* too high. I can find this at my local grocery store for five dollars less *per can* than the price listed here, with even more savings when it's on sale.

Text: Italy in our kitchen
column5: After a wonderful trip to Italy last summer, my husband and I wanted to continue having a cup of cappuccino in the afternoon. After a few experiments with some awful tasting coffees, we finally found Illy fine grind dark roast and it is perfect.It's delicious. It's an afternoon in Rome. I think I could eat the grounds by themselves! We have gotten a few friends hooked on it also and now give it as gifts. It's more expensive than what you'll find in a grocery store, but definitely worth the price, and definitely less expensive than returning to Rome every afternoon for a great cup of cappuccino.

Text: Delic!
column5: I have tried EVERYTHING for our francis francis espresso machine, and had an extremely difficult time to make it taste wonderful. I found this espresso, and the first time I tried it, I was absolutely HOOKED.  Try it; you'll love it!

Text: Illy Cafe
column5: We love Illy coffee but it is difficult and expensive to find in our area.  When I found it on the Amazon web site - WOW!  About half the price and delivered right to my door - and quickly!  I surprised my husband on Christmas morning when he found the can sitting next to the coffee pot.  Excellent!

Text: Excellent espresso
column5: This is one espresso grind that I actually enjoy over and over again.  There is no strange after-taste with some other "premium" brands.  This is a coffee lover's coffee.  It is rich and deep with a slightly nutty undertone.  Try it.  You won't regret it. The canister is nice, too.

Text: Yummmmmmm
column5: I bought this at my local grocery store to use in my new Mr. Coffee espresso machine.  I'm a big coffee nut, I even roast my own coffee. I have a grinder, but at the moment it's about 400 miles away from me :P So I had to settle with this. And to be honest, it's pretty tasty! MUCH better than starsucks' best freshly ground stuff! (tells you how bad SB really is, worst coffee in the universe) But compared to my own stuff, illy coffee is downright nasty! Yes, freshly roasted, freshly ground coffee is that good!  But if you have nothing else available, or you don't want to buy a grinder, this is the best pre-ground, canned coffee money can buy! I can find it in my local grocery store for a lot cheaper than here. Under 12 bucks at the San Antonio based Texas grocery chain.

Text: Perfect Coffee, for my taste..
column5: Perfect Coffee that suits my taste. Goes well with your espresso machines. At times, I mix this Dark Roast and the medium Roast (Illy coffee), and the combination makes perfect coffee for my friends, who doesn't like very dark flavors..

Text: Excellent Espresso
column5: I can get this at my local grocery store, but it's hit or miss whether they'll have the dark roast, fine grind available. The two-pack and auto-delivery ensures I won't run out even if I don't make it to the store. The coffee is a rich, dark roast (for some reason, harder to find than medium roast--seems strange for espresso) and has the best flavor of the Italian imports I've tried.

Text: GREAT COFFEE
column5: Great coffee at a great price.  I live in a very small town and I appreciate that I can order "gourmet" items from Amazon.com.  Illy is the best for home espresso machines.

Text: Yummmmmmmmmm
column5: This coffee is really yummy. I haven't had ground coffee that has tasted this good in a long time. I also like the self sealing can. I put it in the fridge so it will stay fresh longer

Text: Old Fashioned - Press, Steam, Drink
column5: I admit to being old fashioned. My espresso maker is a Krups Il Caffe Duomo. It's a great little machine and it makes great espresso. I have tried at least 6 different kinds of espresso from the national brand where the baristas wear green aprons to most of the others. I settled on Illy because it was the first espresso made, back in the day, and it comes from Italy. The grind is very fine so you will need a basket that can hold fine espresso. If you are familiar with a burr coffee grinder, I will bet that this coffee is ground on a setting of 1. Don't talk to me about pods. Illy makes them but I like this espresso in the can. When you pop the lid, close your eyes and the aroma will take you to a bar in Italy. When you drink the resulting brew, it will have the same effect. It is the real deal and I buy it all the time.

Text: Top-notch espresso at great price
column5: Illy rules. My favorite espresso roast.  Great price.  Excellent.

Text: excellent, rich, aromatic, delish
column5: And it brews perfectly in my automatic drip kitchen coffee maker. A customer introduced me to Illy in her office. I'd had it in restaurants and always enjoyed it, but never thought about purchasing it for my home use. I often mix it with another favorite roast and end up with the best of both worlds. It's a little more expensive than the coffee I regularly buy . The $$ spent for 2 8.8 oz. tins of Illy will buy about 2 LBS. of the other coffee I use. Illy is a luxury I won't give up soon.

Text: One of the best
column5: Illy makes a great cup of coffee that rivals any designer-label coffee you can buy.  I first had it in Neiman Marcus at their in store restaurant and then purchased it for home.  Pricey..yes!  But rich and smooth.

Text: Best espresso you can bring home
column5: If you are someone who finds yourself going to Starbucks or Caribou much more often than you should, save yourself a lot of money and make it at home yourself!  I've tried them all, and can honestly tell you that this espresso is the best that you can get for the home barista.  It may seem expensive compared to the other brands that you can get, but nothing matches the rich dark espresso that you can make with illy.  I actually prefer home-made lattes with this coffee to anything I can buy in town.

Text: It is great !!!!
column5: It is, illy, Ground Espresso Coffe, so nice and great !!!  This taste is very deep and flavor !! I strongly recommend this such a nice coffee !!

Text: Illy is my Madeleine de Proust
column5: illy, Ground Espresso Coffe, Fine Grind (Dark Roast, Black Band), 8.8-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2) When I miss home, I make an illy espresso. I feel immediately better, it is my madeleine de Proust. Illy makes me feel as I were back home. There are wonderful, rare and precious coffees on this planet; but for exactly the same reasons, these beans are also very expensive. Let's think for instance of the Kopi Luwak alias Kafe laku alias Kape alamid (depending on the country that produces it), the Bourbon, or the Blue Mountain etc. Ok, sure they are great coffees if you can afford them. Even if we cannot compare what cannot be compared, Illy is a coffee company which makes fantastic AND affordable coffees. I like the dark ground espresso one because in Europe and especially in Italy we love strong coffee. Plus, I have no grinder. I like the foam on the top and the trace it leaves in my cup once I emptied it. And what to say about its fantastic color and smell? Illy coffee is a very good investment, above all if you love coffee and do not want to spend that much. Next time I am going to try the new espresso collection from Brazil Illy MonoArabica Whole Bean Coffee Brazil full-bodied Coffee 8.8oz Tinand you?

Text: Tasty
column5: This coffee has a rich flavor and nice body without any bitterness, no matter what kind of machine you use. I enjoy it at all  ties of day but especially in the afternoon or after a good meal. Exceptional depth. I love my Illy coffee.

Text: DON'T BUY THIS COFFEE!
column5: It's more expensive than most other coffees.  Once you try it you won't be able to go back.  It's that good.

Text: A different kind of Espresso
column5: I was a bit disappointed with Illy.  It has a great aroma, but when brewed it doesn't have a strong coffee taste or boldness.  I drink coffee to wake up in the morning and break the fog, but this coffee just doesn't pack the punch to get me going.  I really wonder what they put in this Espresso Coffee to make it so aromatic? It almost smells like Pipe tobacco mixed with rum.  All caffeine effects me differently, this espresso made my hair go limp and I just couldn't get myself in gear to do anything.  I drink espresso to help me take on the day, but Illy failed.

Text: Great coffee, but don't buy it online.
column5: I have always loved Illy, and bought two cans at Christmas for delivery with a bunch of other Amazon orders.  I did it purely for the convenience of not having to pick up coffee to take to my holiday destination. However, I was disappointed:  one of the cans had a broken vacuum seal (all Illy cans are vacuum sealed).  Ergo, the coffee was not fresh; and since I couldn't be sure how non-fresh, I tossed it.  The other can was fine. I imagine Amazon would have honored a return, but it's not worth the time on a simple can of coffee. So I must reluctantly recommend you do not buy this product online, since there seem to be quality-control issues and returning to the vendor in that context is a net loss. The coffee itself, though, is very excellent, and I've been a loyal Illy customer for over 10 years.  This is the first vacuum-seal issue I've ever encountered.

Text: I expected more
column5: Well , I learned again to stay away from  ground coffee , for this price ?  it is not bad or bitter but thank you, that was my last time , it is not a coffee for this price believe me   I will use it for making cappuccino , because I do not like the taste of that coffee as espresso   not even the smell , maybe is not my personal taste.. but believe me i am coffee freak and I am still in love with my gourme coffee

Text: Not worth the price, not even close
column5: Personally I don't find the flavor of this coffee in any way special. Purely on volume, this is 17.6 ounces of coffee for more money than 36 ounces of a competing product. It was nice enough, but it wasn't great. It wasn't special. It's just coffee. It does come in a nice tin though, so I took the empties and refilled them with fare trade shade grown coffee. It tastes just as good, to me, and I don't have to worry about the cost of having a few cups of coffee any more. I'm sure there are some people out there who are convinced that this stuff is worth the price. But not for me. If the tins hadn't been reusable I'd have given the coffee a 2 for being overpriced and no better than other competing quality coffees.

Text: Fabulously fudgey!
column5: It is possible to have indulgent stuff without refined sugars.  Classic Fudge is the least sweet of the fudge flavors (according to Wax Orchards) and has a rich, creamy chocolate taste.  The consistency is very much like conventional hot fudge and it takes just 15 seconds to heat a tablespoon in the microwave for pouring or drizzling. I can taste the pineapple juice in this but I like it.  If you want something that doesn't taste like it was sweetened with fruit then this may not be the best match.  I usually warm a tablespoon and toss with a sliced banana and unsweetened coconut.  Delicious! I buy Wax Orchards Classic Fudge at the local natural foods store for about half of the Amazon price.  If you are interested, it's worth shopping around.

Text: MMMmmmmm cheesy!
column5: These are like their other Cheese flavored pretzel pieces, but better! These are actually full nibblers (no not the character from "FUTURAMA", although cute just the wrong nibbler anywhoo ). The flavor is much more smokey than the bright orange counterpart. I also like how most of the cheese is concentrated at the crack of where the pretzel separated so you can experience the flavor at your own pace.  To sum it up, for me these are an adult version of the ever popular chip that is bright orange and has a cheetah for a mascot, and they don't leave cheetle behind, although a good licking session may have to be re-visited, but I digress Buy a pack try 'em out.

Text: The best snack on earth.
column5: Quite possibly the best flavor Snyder's has to offer. Once you've had a bag you will need 5 more and will understand why Amazon sells these as a 6 pack. The only downside is that these are only available here and direct from Snyder's site.

Text: Great and Addicting!
column5: These are a great snack. It's powered cheese and not as good as Cheez-it's but it definitely packs a bigger crunch and satisfies the craving in less pieces than cheez-it's or other products have. One bag will take me a week or two to finish when a similar sized box of Cheez-it's is gone in half the time. They are similar in nutritional value I'd say. If you're a Cheez-it, cheese nips or other cheese cracker fan give these a try if you're looking for something different. You will not be disappointed!

Text: Sweet Snacks
column5: I love these raisins.  I like to have this for when I'm craving sugar and don't want candy.  They're so sweet, I prefer these golden ones, depends on what grape you want.  This is a nice snack for children too.  I like dried mangos but I can't find them here.Dried cranberries are nice too.

Text: Sweet, moist, and tender
column5: I've eaten one full box of these and didn't experience a single bit of stem. Maybe because these golden raisins are moister and tenderer than the dark ones, the stems separate more readily in processing. These are a little sweeter than raisins I'm used to eating, but with a slightly less distinct flavor. I hope my first box was typical . . . they are delightful to eat by the fistful.

Text: A Gourmet Item!
column5: Sun Maid California Golden Raisins, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) These precious little raisins are some of the best food being sold today.  The price on Amazon is less than the ones in the supermarkets, too. We love these raisins straight out of the box, on our cereals, or in our recipes.  We have used them in some of our recipes in The Collard Patch. We buy these often and keep them handy. As grocery prices continue to grow, we are careful to give ourselves little treats like these raisins, which we consider a gourmet product -- actually fit for royalty -- to keep us content with our frugal way of life. Nutritionally they are an excellent source of dietary fiber, energy, and potassium. In 2007, we bought a box of Sun Maid California Golden Raisins that did not measure up to our standards.  Although the raisins were tasty, the box had about 20% dark raisins.  We wrote the Sun Maid Company and expressed our disappointment.  Evidently this occurrence was something they did not expect or accept.  They told us that there is no way to avoid having a few dark raisins in the box but that this box was not representative of their fine product.  And here is the wonderful part of the story:  They sent us coupons for three free boxes of raisins to make things right!  Where could you find a better deal than that?  The Sun Maid people stand behind their product.

Text: Excellent Product from Amazon
column5: I ordered this product from Amazon with hesitancy, which I normally buy from Indian grocery stores.  When I placed the order the shipping date showed as 30 to 45 days, but it arrived in 7 days.  The product was fresher and cheaper than any grocery stores.  I use it as a snack and to and to desserts. I was thrilled with the experience of ordering a food item from a website, from where I only bought electronic items and books.  This is one of the best purchases I made at Amazon. I ordered the "Frontier Cardamom Pods" along with this order to avoid paying shipping charges and plus I use it in Indian tea and desserts.  I give this product 5 stars as it arrived on time, and when I opened the packet it was fresh, and full of flavor and would highly recommend buying this product from Amazon.

Text: Fresh!
column5: Very fresh, great tasting golden raisins and cheaper than what I can find locally. A great buy.

Text: Sun-Maid California Golden Raisins
column5: I really enjoyed eating these raisins and they were absolutely delicious. I will be ordering alot more of these in the near future. They were also fun to eat and i enjoyed snacking on them. Highly recommended.

Text: all right by me !!!
column5: Sun Maid yellow golden raisins are the best brand of yellow raisins on your grocer's shelf--period. These raisins are rather healthy for you. There is no fat, no cholesterol and almost zero sodium to boot! They offer fiber and potassium and that's good, too. However, this food is not an invariable substitute for a vitamin or other fruits with fiber, minerals and vitamins. They are relatively high in sugar (29 grams per 1/4 cup) and they lack vitamins. I'll have to take off one star for that. However, if you want a healthy snack or something to add to your breakfast cereal or oatmeal, these raisins are excellent. They taste great and they are far better than any candy to sweeten your food. Moreover, the raisins do not require refrigeration nor do they bruise or spoil easily. These golden raisins are better than regular raisins if you wish to use a recipe that calls for cooking with raisins. These can come in handy! Note: There should be an expiration date printed on the bottom of the container. Eat or use these raisins before the expiration date so you get them while they're nice and fresh! These raisins are great for persons everywhere who prefer to feed their children fruits as a substitute for candy. They are perfect for people who want to sweeten their food with something 100% natural, too. Raisins provide us all with a healthy snack; and that's a huge plus. Highly recommended--to life!

Text: Great price for golden raisins
column5: These raisins are very fresh and mild tasting. Besides mixing them in with my cottage cheese, I'm going to try the gin and raisin recipe for arthritis. Of course, they will be good in baked goods, too. All in all, I'm very pleased and the price is terrific.

Text: Great raisins!
column5: These golden raisins (Sultanas) taste great. There are a few dark raisins, but not many. These are the perfect golden raisins to use for the Gin and Golden Raisin arthritis "cure" that some books mention. That's one of the main reasons I bought these--they soak up the expensive gin just right.

Text: Great Raisins
column5: Truly fresher raisins that the ones I was purchase in my local store. I was ordering raisins from another vendor but switched to Sun Maid brand because I could get scheduled delivery. I'm concerned that over night Sun Maid's price increased almost $2.00 per order. At that price increase I might return to my other vendor and forget about the inconvenience of placing a order every 3 or 4 months.

Text: Never had them before.
column5: Sun Maid California Golden Raisins, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) WOW, they are GOOD. Sweeter than the dark ones, but not 2 sweet. I can easily get used to them. Love them in my instant oatmeal every morning.

Text: golden raisins
column5: I use these raisins in baking. I find it difficult to find them at the supermarket.  They aren't popular so even our best supermarket doesn't stock them.  However, for delicate coffeecakes, breads, salads, slaws or even oatmeal when  you want the sweetness of raisins  but not the dark color, golden raisins are a good choice.  I soak them to plump them either in warm water or in rum or brandy depending on what i'm making.  I had them recently with pine nuts and sauteed kale at a local restaurant.  This was very good.The golden raisins compliment the slight bitterness of the kale.  The subscribe and save price is very good.  I have them delivered every three months.

Text: great raisins
column5: I purchased these raisins under suscribe/save.  They arrived fresh, plump and moist.  This is a great buy for baking and for snacking (can be eaten right out of the box).

Text: Sweet, good tasting, not great
column5: Good tasting, great snack. All the stuff that everyone else says, but this isn't like overly good. Just like any other brand of sun-maid. It is a little wet to my liking. This wetness is just because the raisins aren't fully dried but still have some moisture inside of them. If you eaten great raisins grown and dried by hand, you'll realize this isn't the best. However, you ain't going to find those anywhere without personally going out to search so until then, this is a good substitute.

Text: golden raisins so much better than normal raisins!
column5: I've been eating golden (bleached) raisins with my daily bowl of oatmeal for breakfast (along with a tablespoon of wheat germ and wheat bran) for 30 years. Have never tried another brand than Sunmaid- very rarely seen another brand. The taste of golden raisins is quite different than unbleached raisins- lighter and fruitier. They're more expensive, but not much. Amazon has them quite a bit cheaper than the grocery stores, and I believe the 15ox boxes are an ounce or 2 more than the grocers.  Never had a single complaint with Sunmaid's raisins in all these years.  Great as a take-along snack too.

Text: Sun Maid California Golden Raisins, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
column5: This product and its delivery met all my expectations. I fully expect to reorder when my present supply is gone.

Text: A little old
column5: I received raisins that had a best if sold by date of only a couple of months out.  The raisins were hard and dry.  I usually get the golden because they are soft and moist.  But these were not.

Text: GOLDEN RAISINS
column5: These are my favorite type of raisins, for baking and just snacking.They are fresh and worth the price.

Text: GREAT FOR ENERGY
column5: I KAYAK AND CYCLE AND THESE ARE GREAT FOR LONGER TREKS.MUCH TANGIER THAN DARK RAISINS.I CURRENTLY DO NOT BUY THEM FROM AMAZON BECAUSE THE ONLINE QUANTITY PRICE NOW EXCEEDS WHAT I CAN PURCHASE THEM FOR LOCALLY AS SINGLES.

Text: golden raisins are the good ones
column5: It used to be, when I was growing up, that the raisins that came in little boxes always had stems.  And curiously, when you'd get a box of Raisin Bran, those raisins were stem-free.  (And sugar coated.)  I don't know if there are different standards in raisin processing.  But at any rate, the golden raisins never seem to have stems and they are less dry and crunchy, than purple raisins can occasionally be.  I like them on cereal mixed with blueberries and cranberries and it looks very pretty with the three primary colors together.

Text: Highest Quality Relaxing Tea
column5: ***** Sweet Meadows is a very relaxing high-quality Numi tea. This herbal tea is certified organic and is kosher. The whole organic chamomile blossoms used in this tea have been cultivated in Egypt's northern valley, and are combined with the finest organic lemon myrtle from the rainforests of Australia. The tea itself is caffeine-free, of course, and has a flowery chamomile and citrus-y flavor. If you like Numi herbal teas, get it---you won't be sorry. *****

Text: 3 Amigos soup mix not so bad
column5: Ok, pretty package & nice to have on hand. If you add 1-2c. Pace Picante Sauce to it, it's pretty good. Even with the suggested add ons, it was dull.

Text: Great Nuts, Excellent presentation .Good choice for Gifts
column5: We will order again, the nuts were large, tasty, and not stale.  The presentation is nice for a gift idea.

Text: Lifesaver
column5: Whoever came up with this is a genius and a lifesaver. I too only use formula when I'm on the go or need to supplement if I don't have enough breast milk, so the can is a waste since I won't finish it in a month. The packets are so convenient. I carry a bottle or two of 4oz water and a couple of packets in my purse at all times for emergencies. Paid $10.69 for a box of 16 at Target. Only 4 out of 5 stars because you can only make 4 oz or 8 oz.  So if your baby is currently eating more than 4oz but less than 8oz you either hope he is satisfied with 4oz or make 8oz and waste some.

Text: Wonderful!
column5: Like others have written I only use formula when my milk production is low or I am mixing it with cereal.  I won't go through a whole regular can in a month (when the packages say to discard after opening).  These are perfect!  No waste!  Easy for travel too!

Text: Very convenient
column5: These single-serve packets are great for travelling. We also keep a few in our diaper bag just in case we need to feed our little one away from home.  It's a very convenient way to make formula away from home, and the cost is only slightly higher than the regular big containers of powder formula.

Text: Enfamil packets
column5: Great to use on the go.  There is less chance that water will get in and contaminate the batch.  I never left the house without these and the baby loved them.

Text: Containers spill. Get these instead!
column5: I bought a Munchkin container with the easy-pour lid, but the lid snapped off and I lost three feedings worth of formula. I've since decided this is the best way to go. They're compact and fit easily into my diaper bag. 4 stars instead of 5 because I wish they came in 6 oz packets, but they are still an absolute necessity for my bag.

Text: Great for travel and at the bottom of your purse
column5: I love having these on hand.  It is a necessity when you are out and about and run out of formula or weren't expecting to need some and have a back up packet in your purse.  I also really like having them for airplane rides, easier when you have less space.  Very much worth the cost of having them packaged like this.

Text: Great for the diaper bag
column5: Love these for on-the-go feeding. Use them at home too since they are not as messy as the formula tubs.

Text: Wonderful!!
column5: Throw a few in your diaper bag in case of emergency and you don't have to worry about space issues or worry about trying to measure out formula in preparation for a long outing.  Like others, I use this to supplement so this is also fabulous for those onesie/twosie feedings that come up when I can't nurse - without having to buy a can of powder.  I got hooked on these when they sent me samples in the mail.

Text: Damaged packaging
column5: I love this for travel and times we're out of the house for most of the day. I was, however, very disappointed when the last time I ordered this, 4 packs in one of the boxes were open.

Text: love these on the go!!
column5: quick and easy if i dont have a formula dispenser on hand! love them! i think you get like 16 to 20 in a pack (not sure) but they are awesome and very helpful!

Text: Love This Product!
column5: I love that I don't have to tote a large can of formula around with me when out shopping, at church, at family functions, etc. I keep a bunch of these in the inside pocket of the diaper bag, grab one out when needed, rip the top off (which is very easy to open), dump formula in bottle that has already had 4 ounces of water put in it (I fill mine at home before leaving), shake, and feed. So easy it's ridiculous! Best on the go product ever!

Text: as expected, yet cheaper than in the store
column5: Has been using this single-served powder packs whenever we are on the road.  I got 3 boxes for our 1-week trip.  Just bring bottled water. Very convenient.

Text: Great! Wish they were more affordable!
column5: These are an absolute must for momma's that are formula feeding and ever need to make a bottle while out. These easy tear packages packed in the diaper bag alongside a bottled water and empty bottle are great. I've tried packaging formula myself, to save money and it is just MESSY and ends up wasting formula that gets spilled (during packaging AND use). The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the price. It's just so expensive and coupons are hard to come by for this type of enfamil product!

Text: Packaging is perfect for our situation
column5: My baby is breast fed but goes to daycare.  I'm no longer pumping as much as she sometimes demands.  This packaging of formula is perfect for that situation.  Any other type would go to waste since she only has maybe 4oz of formula once a week.  This is perfect for a baby that doesn't drink formula everyday and also perfect for travel, no waste and small packaging.

Text: Exelent !!!!!
column5: This is a practical product when you goes out and you are not sure if baby will requires his milk, then you need to fill the bottle with 4 oz warm water and carry the 4oz blister that is ready to use. Price agains big can portion is almost the same. The only problem is when baby eats more than 4oz.

Text: I always take this when I go out with my baby
column5: This is very convenient and whenever I go out with my baby, I always take 3-4 packets with a bottle of water.  I am planning to travel 2 months later and I will buy enough of these to take with me.

Text: Super convenient, super expensive.
column5: We bought this because our little one wasn't a regular formula drinker so it didn't make sense to open large tubs of it, only to throw it away.  It's a great idea but obviously you are paying for the convenience.  I've been thinking of buying a vacuum packer but wasn't sure it was going to work with powder and worth the time and effort.  Also, this stuff is great for long road trips or travel.

Text: Very handy for travel
column5: These are great for the diaper bag and air travel.  There is a limit to how much ready made formula you can bring through security these solved that problem (mix after security check).

Text: Handy when out and about
column5: My wife loves these because it's convenient when we're out shopping or running other errands. No carrying a big container of formula, and trying to get the measurement right in the car   we received samples like this in the mail, but couldn't find them easily except on-line.

Text: Great item
column5: We are very happy with the purchase. This item is very convenient when we are walking with the baby on the street. Easy to open, great taste (I can see it in my baby eyes).

Text: Genius Concept!
column5: Absolutely genius concept. 0 footprint, not like those bulky formula holders! The only thing is they are really over priced here. They're much cheaper purchased at your local store.

Text: Very spicey
column5: I would caution anyone who wants to buy this jerky. The jerky is very over seasoned. You will need a glass of water handy when you eat these. Only good when you heat them for like 15 seconds. Next time I will order the original flavor.

Text: Wonderful for making gluten free food.
column5: Since this was first time using the flakes I was so surprised of the taste when I ate gluten free breakfast bars. The texture was really good and my son ate them I was afraid that he wouldn't like them I wasn't even sure I did the recipe right but he loved them. I will buy these flakes again.

Summary: Marcia C. Brandt Author Step Away from the Ch
Text: Love the Ease of Preperation
column5: I am looking to become gluten free and quinoa is a great way to get protein and avoid the gluten. I fix a bowl for my breakfast and the flakes taste great! Plus the price is better than in my local grocery store. I add cinnamon and raisins and dried cherries. Very delicious. Really a quick, nutritious breakfast. Here's a fun quick read for your lunch hour at work Step Away From the Chocolate (The Ladies on Honeysuckle Road) great for us chocolate lovers. Hey, there's a great idea, maybe I could add dark chocolate chips to my quinoa in the morning. I'll let you know how it tastes.

Text: Easy way to add protein to carb meals
column5: I love adding this to oatmeal (measure out water/grains to equal 2 servings of each product and cook following oatmeal directions), muffins (add in some to replace a portion of flour) and even meatloaf as the thickener/stretcher instead of oatmeal. Love the price here vs. in stores.

Text: Wonderful dog food, good price
column5: This dog food was recommended by our standard poodle's breeder.  She feeds it to both her breeding dogs and her show dogs.  Our dog loves it, and eats every bit of his breakfast, lunch and dinner right down. The breeder said for us to mix the food with a little warm water and a tablespoon of plain, unflavored, nonfat yogurt.  My vet agreed, and said that the yogurt was an excellent addition.  He also has standard poodles as his personal pets. As poodle owners know, the breed can be susceptible to a horrible stomach condition called "bloat."  Feeding your poodle a top grade dog food on a regular schedule is very important for these lovely animals.  This dog food fits the bill perfectly. It is interesting that this is an adult dog food, but the kibble is smallish, and if mixed with the warm water while the dog is a puppy, it can be used throughout the dog's life, once he/she is weaned.  You do not need a puppy chow when the dog is young. This seller provides this food at a fair price, and ships promptly. Recommended.

Text: Best dog food
column5: This product has been excellent for our dogs for the past four years.  Keeps their energy up and their health is great.

Summary: J. Price "Working mom in a hurry"
Text: Love it!!!
column5: This is the first and only iced tea I have purchase since owning my brewer for the past year.  I put off buying iced tea due to the expense and thought how much different could it be from those cheep container mixes you find at the grocery store.  Boy was I wrong.  For starters my favorite ice tea is the half and half lemonade, and I find that these deliver the right amount of flavor, sweetness and that freshely brewed flavor I would expect from a Keurig brewer.  I find myself hiding my k cups from the rest of my family and complaining when the ice tray hasn't been refilled.  Keep in mind everyone's tastes are different and I tend to like my drinks sweet, I find the smaller tea cup setting on my brewer to work the best for this, without having to add additional sweetner or sugar.

Text: Close enough to my favorite coffee shop drink to make me happy
column5: I love going by Starbucks during the hot summer days here in Texas and ordering a shaken black tea lemonade sweetened with light ice. When I got my Keurig brewer and was checking out the drink selections for iced tea I came across this one and had to try it. I was pleasantly surprised that the taste is accurate for the ratio of tea/lemonade and the sugar was sweetened just enough. My son and I love them and he is the one that discovered that the 6 oz. water setting is best for the maximum flavor. These are a staple in my household and I love my Keurig brewer and will be saving money by drinking these at home instead of going to my local Starbucks! They are on 70 calories per serving and you get 25% of your Vitamin C intake for the day too.

Text: I'am addicted
column5: Love this, great hot or cold.  I use lemon in my tea.  Here is a hint, slice lemons in 1/4 inch slices.  Place on a cookie sheet and freeze, allow them time to freeze solid. Then place in a plastic bag and place them back in freezer, just grab what you need.  Maintain their color and look so good in the tea.

Text: Pretty good but beware if you don't like artificial sweeteners
column5: This isn't bad but I can really taste the REBIANA (SWEETENER FROM STEVIA).  I dislike the taste of artificial sweeteners and didn't realize this product was artificially sweetened (though the first ingredient in the list is evaporated cane juice, so I don't know why they needed to add the Rebiana).

Text: Celestial Half and Half lemonade tea for Keurig brewers.
column5: I purchased a box of 16 of these half-and-half (black tea and lemonade) k-cups at Bed, Bath & Beyond.  They had a $9.99/box sale, and it was too good to pass up--especially since my better half loves lemonade iced tea.  Sadly, it was a bit of a disappointment.  It was barely different from the "Perfect Iced Tea -- Sweet Lemon Tea," and didn't have the bite of lemonade.  I wasn't expecting perfection--I realize that lemonade in any form is asking a lot from a hot beverage machine, but it was still a bit of a let down.  Also, I prefer to sweeten my drinks with Splenda.  (I don't need 13 grams of carbs from a glass of iced tea.) That said, my Keurig Limited Edition remains the best coffee machine I have owned to date, and the Coffee People "Donut Shop" variety is my favorite every-morning k-cup.

Text: Mmmmmm .so good .
column5: I first tried this k-cup as a sample.  I was hesitant at first because most teas for the Keurig brewer are either bland, weak, or both.  The sample I tried came in a pack of 4 different iced tea flavors from Celestial Seasonings.  They were are suprisingly very good brewed over ice.  But, this one was by far my favorite.  It has a nice blend of "teaness" and lemon-y sweetness.  A pack of equal or splenda really brightens up the flavors.  I was instantly hooked and ordered a big box of this stuff on Amazon right after trying this drink. As others have mentioned, there is one big caveat to this drink.  It is a caloric drink.  So, if you are looking to restrict your caloric intake in terms of sugary beverages, becareful with this k-cup.  There isn't a whole lot of calories (about 1/2 a can of soda's worth), but it's still there and considering how good this drink is, it's hard to just drink 1.  Other than that, I think this is the best non-coffee beverage available on the Keurig brewer.

Text: Half and Half
column5: Had this at the Marshfield fair in Marshfield, MA.  They were giving it out.  I fell in love with it.  Now that I have my keurig I am sitting waiting for it to arrive.  Nicely sweetened.  NOT WICKED ICKY SWEET.  Brew over is and Mmmmm enjoy

Text: Half and half Iced Tea
column5: Have used this product for a long time and still enjoy its taste very much. Really refreshing and sometimes I add just a slice of lemon.

Text: "Arnold Palmer" K-Cup
column5: Arrived on time and was as expected.  Appears to be the least expensive per serving that is available, even on line.  The larger version (54-count) was less expensive per cup, but was out of stock at the time.

Text: Pretty good for quick iced tea but the Southern Sweet Tea is better.
column5: First, what I love about this flavor is that it's iced tea that is ready in under a minute. Whenever I want iced tea, it's there and doesn't require a lot of work. That being said, I wish it was a little more lemonade flavored than just lemon-ey. Sometimes if I let the drink sit a little too long it takes on pretty acidic lemon flavor that isn't all that pleasant. I also stumbled across a sample pack of the Southern Sweet Tea flavor since ordering this product and I've enjoyed it much more. This flavor is a good try by Celestial Seasonings but it still needs a little work.

Text: Great Combo.
column5: I like my tea with lemon and I also regularly mix iced tea and lemonade so this just made sense for me to buy. It's very good and has a good balance of tea and lemon.

Text: A++ Service
column5: This is the best drink to have over ice on a hot day..Really any of the Ice Tea's have a great taste to them. You make them as sweet as you want or add no sugar at all. My husband seems to be drinking more than me in the Ice Tea world which I find hard to belive.. Time to play catch-up :)  Its also a great drink to offer company instead of coffee, beer, wine, ect

Text: Perfect Summer Drink!!
column5: To start, I did receive a sampler of these as a BzzAgent but I am already purchasing more on Amazon since they were so delicious! It tasted fresh brewed and was extremely refreshing.  Perfect blend of tea and lemonade and light enough to please most tea drinkers.

Text: This is a first for me
column5: Wow, I've never not liked one of the coffees or teas that are made for the Keuring at least until now. Weak and flavorless and is the best I can say about this.
