You get neither a good tea taste nor a lemonade taste.  You do seem to get a bit of a bitter after-taste though. This may be due to  how much the ice cubes melt during production.  Frankly it is easier and less expensive to have a gallon of a good brand pre-made combination drink on hand. Brewed on 8 ounce setting as per manufacturers recommendation. *SAMPLE PROVIDED BY THE MANUFACTURER*

Text: Best Tea Ever!
column5: I love this tea! Although I'm a sweet tea lover, this tea is not too sweet but sweet enough to satisfy your taste buds. I used to buy it at Bed, Bath, and Beyond, but they don't carry it anymore. It's not overly flavored with lemon--just the right amount. Out of all the teas and coffees I have, this one always runs out first.

Text: Daily ritual now!
column5: After reading the reviews, I was a little skeptical about this iced tea.  Being an "Arnold Palmer" fan, I used to make my own at home.  A pot of brewed tea and store bought lemonade.  It was great, but it took some too time to make, and the store lemonade had a lot of sugar.  So, needless to say, when I got this, I immediately made a cup.  I found that the 6oz. setting was the best.  Everyone that has tried it, has really liked it, even the pickiest of my friends and family members.  I don't know what the "chemical" taste that some reviews are talking about, nor the fake sugar taste.  I like the fact that it's real tea, and that the lemonade side isn't too overpowering. I drink this probably at least twice a day now, and will keep it stocked in my Keurig pod holder!

Text: great for summer time
column5: I love this stuff . Everyone one who comes to my house and i make it for them is hooked .

Text: great variety
column5: This K-cup variety pack is great for trying to find which iced tea you like best.  I enjoyed the raspberry the most. Great value and variety.

Text: from the view point of a keurig ADDICT
column5: Abosolutly LOVE it. COULD NOT WAIT to try it. This is the second cold tea i have made with my keurig . This is worth EVERY SINGLE penny

Text: Great taste
column5: As a big fan of Arnold Palmers, half lemonade half iced tea over ice, I'm pleased with this K-Cup variety.  I add a bit of sugar after brewing it over a big cup filled with ice, and its a great alternative to soda or trying to mix an Arnold Palmer myself at home.

Text: really good
column5: I love this iced tea, it is my new favorite.  I think it tastes better than the Celestial regular iced tea, which is also good.  I especially like the fact that it has only half the caffeine, something I'm trying to cut back on.

Text: Best taste yet
column5: I've tried all the iced tea flavors, and buy far like this one best. It could be a touch stronger, but i load it up with alot of ice so I'm sure that doesn't help either, 6 cup setting is my pick also. But all in all way better than a scoop mix brand iced tea mix

Text: Half n Half Iced Tea K-Sups
column5: We keep trying different BREW OVER ICE tea products, but we ALWAYS try to keep this one onhand as it is becoming our FAVORITE!

Text: Better than I expected!
column5: I bought these by accident, but I'm glad that I did. I intended to buy the Southern Sweet Tea flavor, but clicked on the wrong product (I was shopping by image, saw the little ice symbol, and didn't even notice I ordered the wrong thing until it arrived). I decided to give it a try anyway, and I was surprisingly pleased with it. I will say that I think it needs to be sweeter (so I add some stevia or splenda), but otherwise I think it is pretty good. If you like Snapple or Arizona tea with lemon flavor, you will like the Celestial Seasonings Half & Half K-Cup.

Text: Surprisingly Good Tea from Amazon
column5: I was hesitant about ordering this the first time, but was surprised at how good it tastes. It has a true black tea flavor with just the right amount of lemon. I used it up quickly and have reordered it. Occasionally, I add a little sweetener but most people probably wouldn't feel the need to do so.

Text: Tea Time
column5: The ease at which you can make a cup of fresh iced tea is nothing short of amazing. Cost effective.

Text: LOVE it!
column5: I use two pods on the "iced" setting and it is SOOOO good. Even when diluted with ice it remains sweet and has a wonderful flavor. This is NOT lemonaid so if you're expecting the crisp taste of lemonade, you will be disappointed. What it IS is the BEST lemon-twinged TEA I've ever had. And I live in the South, so I've HAD some good sweet teas!

Text: Just Okay
column5: Nothing spectacular.  It wasn't as sweet as I'd expected nor as flavorful.  It seems like I would need to use two just to get one glassful.  I probably wouldn't order them again.

Text: INSTANT SUMMER
column5: A very good blend of iced tea and lemonade.  For those of you who enjoy an "Arnold Palmer" in the warmer months, this is pertfect for you!  Add lots of ice and brew in the 8 oz. or 10 os. settings.

Text: Pleasant surprise
column5: I was pleasantly surprised with the taste of this tea. Great lemon flavor that is not in any way overpowering. I highly recommend this product. Great taste!!!

Text: My favorite ice tea - so far
column5: This is my favorite ice tea so far. Just the right mix of lemon and regular tea. I add the pink sweetener and it's great.  It's fun to experiment so I'll keep trying new ones but I am very satisfied with Half and Half.

Text: Zero stars - this stuff is not good at ALL!!
column5: No tea flavor at all.  Tastes like watered down lemonade.  I drink a lot of tea and this stuff is so bad that I am returning the opened box for a refund.

Text: Funny taste
column5: Thought it tastes funny.  Not like iced tea, not like lemonade and no where in between.  There are much better flavors out there

Text: Terrible.
column5: I know that taste is very subjective, but I'm a big tea drinker, and also love the lemonade/iced tea combination.  This product tastes terrible to me.  It's acidic without the tartness that I enjoy in lemonade, and the tea just tastes "off" to me.  I won't buy it again.

Text: The flavor is terrible
column5: wish I would of tasted one before i bought this half & half.  just to sum it up, it tasted like chemicals. The southern Ice Tea on the other hand is very good.

Text: High Fiber in a Tasty, Healthy Snack
column5: South Beach Diet Fiber Bars/Chewy Granola Bars are tastier than your average granola bar but not quite as tasty as your average chocolate bar--they definitely occupy the middle ground between these two extremes. The rich dark chocolate flavor is quite noticeable in these dense snack bars, which also contain 6 grams of protein and a whopping 9 grams of fiber (that's 36% of the RDA) per serving. These nutritional benefits somewhat offset the fact that saturated fat accounts for more than half of the fat content per serving (2 of the 3.5 fat grams per serving). Each bar contains 120 calories, so overall, this is a pretty good choice if you're trying to balance taste and nutrition.

Text: South Beach energy bars dark choc
column5: Want a party in your mouth and a healthy bar at the same time?? My South Beach dark chocolate bars came from Amazon just as my husband was working to increase his fiber for health sake. This dark chocolate, chewy taste is fantabulous!! It would be great as breakfast bar with coffee or tea in the morning or a delicious snack with extra fiber any time of day. This individually packaged bar is convenient to carry and a delictable chew. South Beach Diet Bar Fiber Granola Bar, Dark Chocolate, 5-Count(Pack of 8)

Text: Way Overpriced
column5: Whoa in doing my research I noticed that one box of South Beach Diet Bar Fiber Granola Bar (that's a mouthful isn't it) costs $23.92 if you order it on Amazon. I have prime but I realize that not everyone does so if you factor in another couple bucks for shipping ridiculous price. I'm not sure how much a box of this costs in stores (considerably less I would hope) but I daresay that it is unlikely that the price is worth the product. If anyone could use a good diet bar it's me but the problem with diet bars is in the name. They are DIET bars. They aren't supposed to taste great (otherwise you'd be in danger of eating the whole box and what kind of diet is that) so instead they usually taste like a mix of cardboard and well more cardboard. Now the South Beach Diet Bar Granola Bar isn't THAT awful. Don't take that delicious looking beast on the package for truth. The real product is much flatter And the taste? Well it tastes exactly what you would think a chocolate diet bar would taste like. It's unfair for me to bash a diet bar based on taste after admitting that diet bars aren't SUPPOSED to taste good but that image on the package really got my hopes up. But how effective is the bar? Effective enough. I ate one this morning and I didn't eat again till later this evening. That's not really praise for the diet bar, I have a pretty hectic schedule. But maybe I didn't notice the hunger as much. I'm guessing I could eat a granola bar (get better taste at a cheaper price) and be the same level as hungry. So if you take diets/diet bars seriously then this might be the bar for you. It doesn't really have anything to separate it from the other snack bars out there other than the South Beach name but hey, what do I know?

Text: Tasty Treat
column5: The South Beach Diet Bar (Dark Chocolate) offer a tasty but relatively healthy treat.  It has a rich though not overly sweet taste and is fiber rich while low on calories.  Don't expect it to taste like candy - this is a granola bar, after all - but it does offer a rare treat for those trying to lose weight.  While the heavier fiber intake may make it a little bit of an acquired taste, the chocolate makes it a lot easier to acquire.  If the rest of losing weight could only be this easy!

Text: Fills the Void
column5: These diet bars have a rich dark chocolate taste but they're a little gritty (too much sugar)? I think the most important aspect of any diet product, if it's palatable and these are, is whether or not they're filling. These do fill the void, but with so much fiber you can expect a gassy side effect. They're kind of like drinking Slim Fast which many people refer to as gas in a can, but that's the sacrifice we dieters have to make to lose weight. They're great if you get up late and cannot wait to cook a plate!

Text: Delicious!
column5: This is the first time I have tried a South Beach product and I am sure glad I did. The have a wonderful taste and are very filling. I will check out more of their granola bars and try them also. 120 calories will fit into my snack plan for the day. Also a good dessert. Very pleased with these bars. Thank you South Beach and Vine for allowing me to try these.

Text: Healthy and Tasty
column5: These diet bars are very tasty with a nice flavor of dark chocolate and a pleasant, non-sticky crunch. With 6 grams of protein and 9 grams of fiber to 6 grams of sugar and only 120 calories, they offer a much healthier snack option than the typical vending machine choices or even a lot of so-called diet products. I have successfully used the South Beach Diet over the past few years both to loose weight and to improve my cholesterol and I have incorporated its principles into the way that I eat all year long. Like some other programs, the first phase of the South Beach Diet encourages morning and afternoon snacks and allows a dessert in the evening. These diet bars are a good choice for anyone on such a program, or really for anyone who just feels like having a healthy and tasty snack or light dessert from time to time. I liked them, and my wife liked them, too.

Text: Among the best
column5: These anchovies are meaty fillets of beautiful fish. I have been using these for years and they are always excellent.

Text: Exceeded expectations
column5: I am totally sold on buckwheat being a super-grain. This product is organic, has great nutrition value and tastes pretty good too. I would not give it 5 starts for the taste, but other benefits added, I recommend it. Just keep in mind, that it tastes a little different than regular pasta, so you may have to experiment a little to find foods/sauces that complement it well. If you have kids, who are addicted to pasta and you want to keep them from overloading on simple carbs and not getting enough other nutrients, this is a very good pasta to try.

Text: Healthy alternative for pasta dishes
column5: Since mid-May I am on WeightWatchers diet, need to put whole grains into my diets (pasta, bread, rice, etc.). I used this today in a macaroni salad. It said to boil 10 to 12 mins, but I'd say, no more than 10; it cooks quickly, and if you overdo it, some will split. It has 5 grams of fiber per 2oz serving, and since I'm on a high-fiber, low fat diet, this is very good. It has barely no sodium. I'm used to whole wheat pasta and like that a lot, but this one will take a little getting used to, not as dense; but for my purposes, it will do.

Text: Great paste for wheat sensitivity!
column5: We love this pasta for the whole family. It's rich in protein and iron and our son, who's wheat sensitive, can have it without any problems.  Tastes great, even better than the normal wheat pasta.

Text: Better than I expected
column5: I love Eden's Kamut pasta and I don't really taste much difference with the added buckweat.  I make italian vodka sauce with these noodles and my family finishes it off quickly.

Text: Healthier than Whole Wheat alone and taste even better
column5: I love the tastes of this pasta. It tastes even better than just 100% whole wheat. Kamut is a wheat type of grain but for what I have read has more micro nutrients (more healthy) and most of person that are gluten intolerant can eat Kamut with no problem. And Buckwheat is pretty nutritious (Whole grain buckwheat is an amazingly nutritious food. Even though it's protein is relatively low at approximately 11%, the protein buckwheat does have contains the eight essential amino acids and is one of the few "grains" (remember that buckwheat isn't a grain at all is more like a fruit) high in lysine. If you use half buckwheat flour with your wheat flour, the buckwheat's amino acids will round out the limiting amino acids in your wheat nicely, giving you a nearly perfect balance of the 8 essential amino acids. This particular balance between half wheat and half buckwheat flour is much more closely aligned to your dietary needs even than lean beef!!! It's also rich in many of the B vitamins as well as the minerals; phosphorus, magnesium, iron, zinc, copper and manganese. In addition to this, it's a good oil source of Linoleic acid, one of the two essential fatty acids we must have to be healthy. Nutritionally speaking, buckwheat is a truly impressive food. Taken from [ ]. Even though, it said that is organic, it doesn't contain any known certification like (USDA) to prove it, so if you looking for an organic strictly food, you would have to take a leap of faith here. So in conclusion, if you are looking for getting a better (in healthy and tastes) to whole wheat this is a pretty good product.

Text: Great tasting and very high in fiber
column5: I love all of Eden's products I have bought and I have bought many. They have quality in every package. This item is something I bought thinking it was gluten free, but after reading more info on Kamut via the internet, I don't think it is. Thankfully I am not gluten intolerant, simply wheat sensitive. This product does not seem to have the same affect on my body as regular wheat. It is high in fiber (5g) per serving for pasta and 9g of protein (Unheard of in pasta), plus high in phosphorus and magnesium (both 20% of the recommended daily requirements). My boyfriend who is a huge bread and pasta lover said this tasted just like the real thing served with spagetti sauce - we did not try it alone with butter.

Text: Great product
column5: This product not only has great flavor it is also very healthy when compared to wheat and flour grains. Highly recommend.

Text: Eden Organic Kamut & Buckwheat Rigatoni, 100% Whole Grain, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
column5: I am off wheat, and this pasta is so delicious. It is very firm, as we eat our pasta "al dente", I will buy this pasta from you again and again,

Text: Awesome!!!
column5: GREAT TASTE!!!  PUT A LITTLE LIGHT OLIVE OIL AND SALT ON IT, YUMMY!!!  GREAT PRICE TOO!  WOULD TOTALLY AND DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!!

Text: Makes a great cup of coffee
column5: The coffee pods fit the Senseo coffee maker perfectly and makes a wonderful full flavored coffee.

Text: What's not to like? Fair Trade and Gourmet Puck Dark
column5: We've been buying these for about a year. I find it delicious, convenient and a bargain in every way. The pods are the right size for the Senseo machines. You will like it, too.

Text: 8 gram pods are too small
column5: The 8 gram pods do not hold enough coffee, i.e., grams, and coffee is very week if making over 4~5 oz.  Waste of money.  I had to re-order and get 12 gram pods to have good tasting coffee.

Text: Great coffee pod for the Senseo coffee maker.
column5: My husband and I both love strong but not bitter coffee. When he tried this, he said he wanted for me to buy more. I use the double pod holder because the pod is thick. If you like a rich, strong cup of coffee, you will love this.

Text: Good all around blend
column5: This makes a good all around cup of coffee, with low acidity, and not too weak as tends to be the coffee pods for the Bunn My Cafe machine.  I use this if I want to add a flavored creamer.

Text: better cup
column5: this is an upscale flavor of coffee fair trade & organic that's what make me decide to go ahead with it.  just wish there would be an expiration date on the product

Text: SOUTH PACIFIC DARK
column5: Wofgang Puck's South Pacific Dark blend is very disappointing--very light and very weak. Will not buy it again.

Text: NOT K CUP
column5: I have no idea what the actual coffee is like.  This is because, even though I specifically searched for Keurig cups, Amazon displayed these.  And I bought them because Amazon led me to believe they were k cups, only to discover I can't use them BECAUSE THEY DON'T GO IN MY MACHINE.  I'm writing this as a warning since I've ALSO just found out AMAZON DOESN'T ALLOW RETURNS OF GROCERY ITEMS.  Awesome.  Money down the tube.  Watch me NOT get more grocery items from Amazon in future.

Text: not so good
column5: I bought this on accident meaning to buy k- cups. It is instant coffee and taste that way, Wolfgang Puck can't even make instant taste good.

Text: Not Keurig cups!
column5: This is not a review on the quality of the coffee but on the Amazon product selection process. I was specifically searching for Keurig cups and so stated in my query. This product was included on the Keurig cup list. When I received my product I discovered pods rather than cups. I should have read the discription more closely but didn't since I was expecting only Keurig cups. The Amazon search process should exclude products that don't meet the query parameters. Otherwise it is buyer beware! I will use that pods but it is not the convience of the cups.

Text: Delicious and approcable blend from historic Napa Winery
column5: A great blend in which Joe Hurliman manages to coax out the absolute best characteristics of each varietal and one that the sum is far greater than it parts.  Were it not for the high price tag, given its obvious edge in complexity and ageability, it would easily replace the Recanati Petit-Sirah/Zinfandel as my blend with which to introduce new wine drinkers to the wonderful world of wine.  The combination of good acidity and balancing fruits make it pretty food-friendly and the wood and tannins combine to make this a real wine with the ability for some nice aging and evolving complexity.

Text: Great packaging, long lived
column5: Great stuff - Tough, durable plastic container, used as frequently as anything else on my spice rack but held up well. No huge surprises in terms of taste, but definitely a handy thing to have around. Minus one star for lacking a clear expiration date (but my jar's at least two years old) and for failing to sell individuals. That whole "two years old" thing makes me feel a little ridiculous pricing a four-pack.

Text: Very Tasty, Definitaly Better Than Xyla Brand!
column5: I have tried the Xyla brand in a few flavors and their candy develops into sharp edges in your mouth as you suck on it, enough to cut your tongue! This brand doesn't do that at all. Phew! It behaves like normal hard candy, and tastes really good as well.

Text: Green Tea With Smooth, Delicate Taste and a Touch of Sweet Spearmint
column5: Pukka Mint Green Tea is organic whole leaf tea with sweet spearmint, which gives it a delightful smooth, delicate taste. After a stressful day yesterday, I really enjoyed the mint added to the green tea.  They have an interesting selection of teas for different purposes: revitalize, after dinner, day & night, detox, refresh & soothe digestion, etc. Ingredients: Fairtrade Sencha green whole leaf (70%), Fairtrade spearmint leaf (30%). 100% organically grown. Fairtrade ingredients certified to international Fairtrade standards. total 100%

Text: PROBLEM SOLVED QUICKLY  WITH ORDER ON HIGH QUALITY PRODUCT
column5: Excellent quality product. A very caring seller and Amazon fulfillment took care of all issues I had with the delivery.  Really feel comfortable with buying through Amazon after seeing the  procedures in place for handling any probs with orders.

Text: Best chocolate candy around!
column5: This is my favorite Graffiti Zoo product-the flavor is so intense-if you like orange & chocolate-you'll love this stuff.

Text: Yum! Graffiti Zoo Backstage Calicos
column5: Delicious! broken slabs of delectable chocolate with a nice tart bite of orange! Comes in cute little bags with just the right amount in each one.

Text: Graffiti Zoo Zebra Chodcolate
column5: Tried this and this was some of the best chocolate i have tried in a while, I loved the roasted Pecan with the White and Milk chocolate. I would recommend this to everyone.

Text: If you have not tried Pinahs Rye Chips, you are missing a lot
column5: We received our shipment of Pinahs Rye Chips last week and have been enjoying them ever since.  Served them at my Bridge Club and all three women begged for a box.  Will have to reorder soon.

Text: My wine club favorite
column5: I belong to a wine tasting group that has somehow evolved (devolved?) into a competitive hors d'oeuvres club. No cheese and crackers for this group (even though that's what would probably complement wine the best). And then one of our group brought these chips. They are just delightful without being fussy, e.g., not spicy, salty, overdone. These are plain and go with everything from dips to hummus to cheese - any cheese. I love to put them in the bottom of a soup bowl and then pour tomato soup over them. They're great on salads, too. A definite "find".

Text: good stuff
column5: It's a big bag of dog food, just like it says.  My dog was on the Prescription Diet for sensitive stomachs, but she has adjusted to this food pretty well and it is easier to get (doesn't require a trip to the vet) and cheaper.  Give it a shot.

Text: So thankful
column5: I made the mistake of trying to switch my dog (large breed boxer) to one of the currently trendy "grain-free" dogfoods  and he did not thrive at all.  Loose stools, chronic diarrhea, weight loss, etc.  6 long months of misery for both of us before vet recommended this food.  It solved all of his digestive problems; his weight is getting back to normal and his coat is shiny.  He feels better too - lots of energy, doesn't have to potty as often, etc.  Really happy I found a dogfood that is so gentle on his stomach.

Text: Excellent my picky eating dog loves it.
column5: My Assistance Dog loves this food.  After trying numerous foods for dogs with sensitive stomachs, and him refusing to eat, I gave him this Science Diet dog food, as recommended by his vet, and he gobbles it down.  His 'job' is very stressful and he is a very sensitive, alert dog, which leads to his stomach being easily upset, but with Science Diet, he has no problems and loves the food.  I am homebound and ordering the dog food can be pricey, so occasionally I try another high quality brand, but he won't even give it a try well maybe a bite but then he sits down and looks at me like 'okay, is this a joke, where's the good stuff?' it may cost a little more, but he is worth it and earns every bite!

Text: Undrinkable, IMHO
column5: This is hands-down the worst coffee I've ever had. It's weak, flat, and lacking aroma. Worst of all, it has a weird musky, mildewy, stale taste. It's also quite acidic, even for a light roast. My guess is they use cheap beans. I'm not a coffee snob, but this isn't what coffee should taste like.

Text: Easy Char siu
column5: If you like Chinese Pork, and Ribs. This is an easy way to make Char siu. You can make Char siu yourself with a couple of ingredients, but this is good also.

Text: Very, yummy!
column5: I have really enjoyed these caramels.  The flavor, chewiness, and texture are just like the chocolate-covered caramels you find in candy boxes.  Very satisfying if you love caramels.  The flavor of the caramel is very full and rich; I can't tell that it's sugar-free.  The chocolate coating needs some improvement in flavor in my opinion. It could have a richer milk chocolate flavor, and be a bit sweeter and a little silkier.  That said, it doesn't taste bad, and certainly doesn't keep me from enjoying the candy! My very favorite s-f caramels are JUDY'S, but if I can't get those, then these Russell Stover's run a close second. I've avoided all artificial sweeteners for YEARS, only rarely have had regular candy during that time, and until recently didn't do any sort of sugar-free.  Lately I have been really missing nice caramels, and as I need to keep a close eye on the carbs, I've made an exception with this candy being artificially sweetened. On the whole, I think I'd rate this candy 8 or 9 out of 10.  [Very yummy!]

Text: Fast and perfect!!!
column5: After making my own bubble tea for the first time with the regular 30mins-1hr boba, I decided to try the minute pearls.  I was quite skeptical about whether the "minute" pearls could be even close to being thoroughly cooked in anything under less than an hour b/c the regular bubbles took that long and there was still raw, dry starch in the center, which was quite annoying even after following the direction strictly.  But with the minute pearls, I pured them into hot boiling water and by the time I turned around they were completely cooked to the center and chewy.  I was ecstatic cos it was just like the kind in my local boba tea shop.  Now i can save my money and make all kinds of tea at home for myself, my husband, friends, family!

Text: yummy!
column5: These are great! Take a long time to ship and receive, received on the last day.

Text: Realy nice!
column5: (Im sorry for my english, im not from eua)This is very pretty, but teast like nothing, are just to see, not to eat! i used for my 2 year old b. party for my daghter, the theme was snow white, i used to put in the whitch table as a magic potion! it was beautifoul, i gave 4 stars just for the taste, if u want to buy to eat, dont, it teast like nothing!

Text: Diabetic Delight
column5: Are you a chocoholic? Overweight? Diabetic? And a food elitist to boot? Then this is the chocolate bar for you. These are delicious. I've been eating the dark chocolate bars for years and was delighted to find chocolate with almonds. I find the milk chocolate bars a bit chalky and the chocolate raspberry bars cloyingly sweet, but the dark chocolate bars are excellent and the chocolate with almond bars even better. Yes, they are a bit pricey. And yes, they're worth it.

Text: Delicious sugar free chocolate with no stomach upset
column5: I have tried other sugar free treats sweetened with malitol and other sugar alcohols. Tasted okay, but caused prohibitive gastric distress. Like the kind of pain you would not wish on your worst enemy, accompanied by a multi-sensory symphony of humiliating bodily expressions. I read that the sweetener erythritol had low glycemic impact, but none of the accompanying health problems, but still felt a bit nervous. All of the current dietary suggestions include a bit of dark chocolate for its antioxident benefits, so I decided to give these bars a try. I am very pleased with the taste of the chocolate. It is very rich and satisfying. No problems with digestion, even when I went a bit overboard with quantity! The erythritol does have a mild "cooling" effect as it melts in your mouth, but I rather liked the effect. Like powdered sugar melting in your mouth, or the coolness of mint without the mint flavor. The almonds (also on many 10 ten food lists of dieticians) are a wonderful addition. I wish it was not so expensive, but I am going to try to limit myself to a piece or two a day for good health and happiness and hope that more competitors enter the erythritol sweetened chocolate market and help drive down the price a bit. In the meantime, I will definitely buy again!

Text: Awesome!
column5: I didn't want to buy a case of these before trying them out, so I finally found some at a local health food store.  The dark chocolate with almond is the first one I've tried, and it was great, really gave a good chocolate fix and has so much fiber in it, it was super filling just eating a square (which is so not like me lol!)  I like the ingredients a lot and it is hard to find candy like this that you can eat with no guilt and still actually like the taste.  So far no stomach issues either, it is sweetened with eyrithrotol (spelled wrong I know) and there is almost no other sugar free candy I can find  that is, and most of the other sweeteners used in SF candy do NOT agree with me causing a lot of stomach pain. I'd recommend trying to find one to test before buying a case of something this expensive though - even ask your local health type store if they'll order a case and sell them one by one or something.

Text: Love Chocoperfection!
column5: I just love these delicious dark chocolate with almonds bars.  They are 0 on the glycemic index.  Found them cheaper on another site.

Text: Older Cat Didn't Like It - Pieces Were Too Big for Her to Eat
column5: My beloved cat, Lily, is 15 years old and is smaller than normal for her age - she weighs only 5 lbs. Still, she has the appetite of a lion. I bought this thinking it was perfect for an older cat, but this dry food has bigger pieces than what she's used to. She has trouble chewing it and so leaves a lot leftover in her bowl. Wasted my money. I feel mislead by the label. You would think the dry food would be made easier for an older cat to digest.

Text: Cat Senior Plus dry food
column5: My senior cat has a very sensitive system (hyperthyroid disease) and she tolerates this food well.  My huge younger cat seems to enjoy it as well!!

Text: Didn't Like The Taste.  Vendor Refunded My Money No Questions Asked!
column5: I didn't like the tase of the raspberry extract. When I contacted the vendor there were no questions asked and my money was refunded and I didn't have to send it back.  I would order from them again, just something else.

Text: Great, mild decaf flavor!
column5: We drink about 4-5 K-cups in our house each day, and this one always seems to be a favorite.  It's hard to find decaf flavors that actually taste good, but I really enjoy this one.  It's the same as most flavored coffees, in that it's a mild/lighter brew.  It tastes exactly like you'd expect a standard French Vanilla brew to, and I don't notice any fun aftertaste (like I do with some brands).  If you love dark/bold brews, this one won't do it for you, but if you just like a little after-dinner treat and don't want to be up all night, this is your K-cup.  Oh - and the person who said they sent the wrong product - you need to rate the seller that sent it (in your account/history settings).  It's not right to take it out on the actual product.

Text: Bold and flavorful!
column5: This coffee is very aromatic and full of flavor! When brewing the kitchen is filled with the aroma of warm vanilla! The coffee is very smooth and full flavored. I bought this for my husband because he doesn't tolerate the caffeine so this was a wonderful substitute! Love it!

Text: Great Vanilla Flavor
column5: I was very impressed with the flavor of these pods. I can't find French Vanilla decaf grounds anywhere, much less in pods. When I pack my Solofill Cup, Refillable K-Cup For Keurig Brewers with loose grounds I can easily get two cups of full flavor coffee out each fill. Not really so with these prefilled pods. But it's a small price to pay for a good cup of coffee that I can have in the evening.

Text: Packing
column5: The product is great, but it came poorly packed!  The boxes containing the K-Cups were all broken apart. Some of the K-Cups were dented but fortunitly none have leaked so far.

Text: Who knew they made flavored decafs?
column5: For the 1st 2 years of owning a keurig I had only seen decaf coffees without any type of flavoring. I found this product and now this is all I drink for decaf. Great flavor and aroma.

Text: Tasty decaf coffee
column5: We purchased this coffee primarily for when my mother-in-law visits as she only drinks decaf.  She loves it and now buys it at her house too.

Text: great
column5: the coffee had a great and different taste, not bitter but bold i will purchase again in the near future.

Text: A favorite around here
column5: It is a nice coffee, with subtle flavoring.  Since it is a decaf, we enjoy it in the evenings quite often.

Text: Full flavor
column5: Green Mountain is great coffee and the French vanilla decaf is full of flavor.  I like the decaf breakfast blend, too.  More decaf flavors, please!

Text: Deeeelish!
column5: I love this decaf coffee.  It is very mild and tasty.  I use the highest size coffee setting for my k-cup and it is great.

Text: Weak uneventful coffee
column5: This Green Mountain French Vanilla Decaf is weak coffee and lacks the taste of other French Vanilla coffee. The best I could do with this is brew it at a 6-oz cup to give it some flavor. I cannot wait until it's gone and I can try another decaf. Don't settle for this coffee when you have other choices available.

Text: Great Flavor
column5: I love my Keurig and I love this coffee. Great flavor and great price. Got to me fast and fresh.

Text: Green Mountain makes good stuff
column5: The huge selection, quality product, and affordable prices make Green Mountain a "go to" supplier for K cups.  This French Vanilla decaf is as expected, tasty and lacking motivator.

Text: Love This Decaf Coffee
column5: I have a single cup Keurig coffee machine. I can't have caffenine and I love the French Vanilla Flavor of coffee. I've tried several other K-cups of different French Vanilla and didn't like the taste of any of them. I ended up tossing them all in the trash. When I tried this Green Mountain French Vanilla in K-cups that is Decaf, I can't seem to get enough of it. There's no after taste, which is wonderful. What I do, is make this coffee during the evening (when I crave it the most) and add some cinnamon and stir. Then I add some International French Vanilla Cream for sweetness to my liking, and then add Fat Free milk to finish it off. The flavor for me is absolutely Heaven! Even drinking it in the evening, it doesn't keep me up all night, and when I go to bed, I sleep like a baby and get a good nites rest. I won't be changing to any other brand or flavor. This tastes so incredable! It's just as described being luschously rich and smooth. It's also a Light Roast, so It's perfect for me and I can add any extra flavors (like the cinnamon) I mentioned. I Very higly Recommend this for anyone, especially ones that can't have the caffine! And the price is very reasonable! Love it, Love it, Love it!!!

Text: good flavor
column5: green mountain makes great coffee, yet to find a bad one. good flavor for a decaf. luv the Kuerig machine. not bad pricing

Text: Yes!!
column5: I live in a small town so it is next to impossible to find decaf k-cups, and even more impossible to find them at this price! Exactly what I wanted!

Text: great decaf
column5: Was looking for a flavored decaf coffee, and this was perfect!  With a little vanilla creamer couldn't have been happier.  Tasty!

Text: Yummy good says my sister.
column5: I don't drink decaf, but my sister only drinks decaf.  I originally bought Green Mountain French Vanilla Decaf as a gift.  Now every time her supply gets low, she wants me to order more for her.  She says it's definitely a 5 star.  Just the right strength and taste for her. I also order my favorite from Amazon on a regular basis. I drink Timothy's Midnight Magic. We love Amazon. Patricia,  Hollywood FL

Text: French Vanilla Decaf
column5: I love my Keurig and the green mountain coffee french vanilla decaf, delicious, especially when I mix it with some coffe-emate french vanilla creamer!

Text: Good Decaf Fr. Vanilla Coffee
column5: Seems difficult to find decaffeinated French Vanilla coffee in the K-Cups.  I guess most people want their caffeine.  I personally find all the K-Cups to be too expensive but I suppose you're paying for the convenience.  Green Mountain has a good vanilla taste at an average k-cup price (around 65 cents/cup).

Text: Not bad
column5: Green Mountain French Vanilla Decaf is just ok. I have only tried 2 different kinds of coffee with my new Keurig and think so far that the Green Mt. is not as good as the Caribou coffee.  I will probably try others and only come back to this kind if I don't find others that are better.

Text: Great coffee
column5: I recently purchased a Keurig coffee maker and have been finding it difficult to find decaf coffee for it. I love Green Mountain French Vanilla coffee, the flavor is great and the convenience of making one cup at a time is definitely the way to go for me. Amazon has a good price so I will be ordering more soon.

Text: K cups
column5: Purchased for gift. Easier to find decaf and cheaper ordering on line. Got just what I was looking for. I knew  the recipient of this gift would be happy

Text: PEGGY
column5: THIS IS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS SOMETIMES I ADD A LITTLE VANILA ICE CREAN AND IT REALLY TASTE GOOD BUT THAT IS ONLY AS A TREAT.

Text: Not what I thought
column5: Hardly has any vanilla taste so I still had to add creamer. Very disappointing. Decaf taste was odd, I'll drink it but not without adding a lot of flavorings to it.

Text: Good, but not Great.
column5: Flavor on this item was okay, but not as good as the Chai.  I love the Dunkin Donuts vanilla decaf and was hopeful I could recreate it at home, but this was not even close

Text: Awesome coffee
column5: I've been drinking Green Mountain Regular French Vanilla coffee for several years now.  I wanted to cut my caffeine intake but had concerns about giving up taste.  I must say that I was pleasantly surprised with the French Vanilla Decaf .the taste is really good.

Text: Great coffee
column5: I am so glad to find flavored coffee  k-cups  My husband and I both love the taste and the aroma.

Text: Love Green Mountain
column5: I love green mountain products. Amazon has a great price for it and it's so worth it. Lately I have been switching over to solofil cups, but that's just because I can sit at home and drink 4 or 5 cups a morning on the weekend. When i'm in a rush going to work I'll pop one of these in.

Text: good coffee
column5: K Cups are great. Green Mountain French Vanilla Decaf is an above average with good flavor of french vanilla and good coffee

Text: Best Flavored Coffee
column5: Even if you think you don't like flavored coffees, try Green Mountain. It is so delicious. Such a treat for your breakfast.

Text: Not for me
column5: I purchased this coffee because I love Gloria Jeans French Vanilla and was hoping to cut back on caffeine.  This coffee has a terrible aftertaste.  I tried it several times, but the rest of the k-cups will never be coming out of the box.  Yuck.

Text: Good flavor
column5: The Green Mountain French Vanilla Decaf coffee tasted good; vanilla flavor was not too heavy.  The cup fit perfectly in a Keurig coffee maker.

Text: Slice of Heaven
column5: There are not too many flavored coffee that also come in decaf so I was very excited to try this product. It is the perfect pick me up for anytime of the day.

Text: VERY GOOD!!!
column5: There aren't too many flavored decaf coffees, so I decided to try this one.  It's very good & I'll probably order it again.

Text: Could use more flavor
column5: - Good decaf coffee for the Keurig coffee maker  - Could use more flavor, I also use the Coffee-Mate French vanilla flavor to help get the true french vanilla taste.  - Price is right compared to in store, little cheaper on Amazon in my experience

Text: Wrong Product
column5: They sent me hazelnut and I ordered vanilla--I think they should send me an order of VANILLA decaf for free

Text: Wow! Incredible product!
column5: If you bake for someone who is gluten intolerant and get a little discouraged with the "gritty" consistency of your baking, you must try this flour! I received mine today and mixed up a batch of Wendy Wark's GF flour blend, using the superfine brown rice flour for both the brown and white rice flour called for in the recipe. I then made a batch of chocolate chip cookies. Let me first say, I am a gluten eater, my husband is the one that needs to eat GF. So I have had wheat based homemade cookies very recently. I have been trying new GF recipes for him during the 2 years since his diagnosis, trying to get as close to what he was used to as possible. This is the first time that even the raw cookie dough tasted like wheat based CC cookie dough! The cookies baked up beautifully and looked like regular. The taste and "mouth feel" was nothing short of miraculous. These did not elicit a response of "they're fine" but rather, "These are great!" When my kids came home from school, they saw cookies and had a couple. When I told them they were GF and I had made them for Daddy, they didn't believe me. I think I will have to make some more very soon as the ones I made today are almost all gone, thanks to my husband and the kids! I now have a flour that has given me that "perfect" GF CC cookie recipe to file alongside the "perfect" GF brownie recipe and the "perfect" GF pizza recipe. Maybe I will have to tackle bagels next? I only hope a store near me starts to carry this or I will go broke on S&H! But I will gladly pay the S&H to have this product available to me! I can't wait to try it in other recipes.

Text: a must have gluten-free pantry staple
column5: I use this flour exclusively for my flour blends that call for brown rice flour.  Superfine is a true adjective for this product.  It makes all of my baked goods indistinguishable from their wheat counterparts.

Text: Superfine Indeed!
column5: Say bye bye to gritty GF flour!  I bought Authentic Foods Superfine Brown Rice Flour based on the suggestion from a stellar book called Gluten Free Baking Classics by Annalise Roberts.  Her recipes call for a blend of Brown rice flour, Potato Starch(not flour), and Tapioca flour and all my recipes come out perfectly.  I supplied all the desserts for Easter and everyone raved about how GF baked goods are better that the original.  Well they hadn't tasted the trial and errors of previous mixes and flours.  So buy Authentic Foods Superfine Brown Rice Flour and The Gluten Free Baking Classics by Annalise Roberts and no one will ever know you've baked GF unless you tell them.  P. S. I even received a call from my "Simon Cowell" friend the next day saying he couldn't stop eating the left-overs.

Text: Great but . . shipping . .
column5: I also bought this flour based on a recomendation from the book Gluten Free Baking Basics, which i bought from this site (and love!).  It is true that this rice flour is the best quality rice flour I've used yet - however, for me the shipping cost as much as the flour, which i found hard to live with.  You can get white rice flour at an asian market, much cheaper, and also a fine ground.  However, the texture when using the asian white rice flour is a bit gummier - this brown rice flour has a much better texture.  I'm only rating at 4 stars due to the craziness of having to ship flour.

Text: Great stuff!
column5: I read about this in "Gluten-Free Baking Classics" by Annelise Roberts, so I ordered some.  What a difference!  Love it!  No grittiness in my GF baked goods.  Thanks!

Text: Pricey, but worth every cent!
column5: This is a must for gluten free cooking.  Don't let anyone tell you any different, there is a huge difference in rice flours.  This one is non-gritty, and does not have an offensive smell.  We love and can not live without this flour! Annalise Roberts suggests this flour in her cookbooks. Buy one of her books, they are reasonable and you'll be thrilled.  You might even cry a little! Her bake goods taste normal!

Text: Shipping
column5: It seems everyone agrees that this is a great product.  The shipping is absurd. Since I can't quote prices I will simply say that if you buy this alone, as the number of bags goes up, the price of shipping per bag goes down. I plan on buying in bulk.

Text: superfine and divine
column5: Just made some gluten free bread using this flour and the Authentic foods sorghum flour. These flours make wonderful bread. Its a keeper.

Text: Much better then normal brown rice flour
column5: I was really discouraged with the gritty texture of gluten free baking.  This flour creates a texture that is almost identical to normal flour in baked goods.  Thank goodness!

Text: Must Have For GF Baked Goods!
column5: Yes, shipping is ridiculous - but if you want to make the cakes, cookies, lemon bars to die for, etc., from Gluten Free Baking Classics, you have to have this flour.  There is no substitute.  I make the lemon bars all the time - they are constantly requested by my non gf family.  You don't need this flour if you make the breads from GFBC, only the sweets, but who wants to go through life without the sweets? There is little difference between buying it from Amazon and buying it directly from Authentic Foods - I think Authentic Foods direct was a few pennies cheaper.  Suck it up, count the shipping as part of the cost of the flour, swallow hard, and never look back

Text: Best brown rice flour!
column5: The extra fine grind of this flour and their white rice flour allows cooks to create wonderfully textured baked goods.  When combined with other starch flours to make a flour blend, items bake up with a lovely crumb.  Guests don't even realize you're serving GF foods!

Text: Wow, These are Good!
column5: I think these are the best chips/crisps I've ever had.  They are thick cut and they come in all different sizes and shapes.  No pringle uniformity here.  Most of the chips are huge and they have potato skin on the outside! These are amazing! I'm eating the Salt & Vinegar right now and trying to stop since I should be in bed. OMG so good..

Text: A satisfying snack
column5: I love these almond oat goji cookies.  I have actually lost 5 pounds eating them as my snack instead of some other processed cookie.  They satisfy my craving and make me feel good. I love that they are made with organic and natural ingredients.  Mid-morning, I look forward to a couple of these goji cookies.

Text: Not Quite As "Tasty" As This Brands Other Flavors..
column5: I ended up buying this 12 pack of "Smoothie" flavor because I really enjoyed the "Mixed" & "Superfruit" flavors from this brand.  Out of the 3 I would say this is my least favorite though. The flavor I most dislike is the almost clear colored one (which I believe is mango.  All the rest are pretty good, although I think peach tastes a little different than the "Mixed", perhaps because of the "smoothie" (or cream) flavor added. I look forward to trying the other two kinds-- "wild berry", and "sport". If you're new to this brand, I recommend you try some of their other flavors before this one. EDIT:  I just received the "wild berry" today, and I must say, it's my favorite flavor pack to date!  If you can find them for a good deal, don't hesitate to scoop it up!

Text: DO NOT BUY! - READ THIS FIRST
column5: As a previous reviewer has stated, (I wish I had seen this before I purchased) the item description states, "LUNDBERG FARMS 12x 2 LB ECO-FR BASMATI BROWN RICE." This is NOT the case. You will receive only 1 2lb package of rice. Deception in advertising and an absolute LIE.

Text: DONT BUY. Misleading product description
column5: The product description says that you will receive 12 packets of 2lbs each. But you will receive ONLY ONE PACKET of 2lbs! So you end up getting 2lbs of rice for $11. Very deceptive.

Text: I love this rice - creamy and soft
column5: I use 1.5 times the recommended amount of water for my rice cooker with this and it comes out creamy like white rice. My husband was having a hard time switching to brown, but now loves it. This rice is delicious!

Text: Excellent basmati rice source
column5: Best price,available in small quanity for individuals, quick delivery, good quality.

Text: Great price!
column5: These pumpkin seeds were exactly the same as the ones they sell at markets for nearly $4 for half the price.

Text: Best Salt/Spice Combo
column5: This is indeed the best salt/spice combo I've ever found. Our family uses it in just about every dish. The combination of sea salt and garlic compliments just about every food we prepare. As the label says, it is "Great on chicken, steak, burgers, fish, pasta, soups, eggs and vegetables." It also rocks in soups, dips, some salads and sauces too. The convenience of having these two indispensable spices in one package saves time in the long run as well. The plastic mill is easy to use; just give it a few shakes, remove the cap and grind away. Ours lasts us up to six months. If you live in a humid climate like I do, the contents can start to stick a little, but I find a few sharp taps on the counter and some vigorous shaking loosens things right up. Salt and garlic lovers, look no further!

Text: Love it!!!
column5: Every since Costco had the Garlic Sea Salt Grinders a few years ago we have been looking for something similar.  We wanted to buy a large grinder and most of what are offered on the market are small containers.  We were very glad to find the large Olde Thompson Garlic Sea Salt Grinder,  and even more happy that they were sold in two-packs and were very reasonably priced.  The flavor is very good.  We are very pleased with the product.

Text: Olde Thompson Garlic Sea Salt
column5: Arrived on time and in good condition.  Love this item but can't seem to find it in any of my local grocery stores.

Text: Authentic Popcorn Tubs
column5: These were just what I expected, only bigger! LOL Just like what you would get at the movies. I used them to make move-themed gift baskets for Christmas. I used the container to hold a DVD, a package of popcorn, and 2 packs of hot chocolate. I wrapped it all up with cellophane and a bow. It was beautiful! And they can use the container for their popcorn. I was very happy with the product for the price.

Text: Great tubs!!
column5: Just like the real deal at the theater!!!  A little pricey but great for impressing friends!! There nothing like having your movie theater popcorn in a PAPER tub.

Text: Sent Immediately
column5: Thank you for sending the popcorn butter tubs right away so that I could get my Christmas order out on time.

Text: Friends say, "Just like normal cookies"
column5: I've fed these to quite a few wheat-eaters, and they see no difference between these and other cookies.  I have tossed in various combinations of nuts, dried blueberries, chocolate chips, and coconut and cooked them as bar cookies.  Everyone loves them.  They disappear within 24 hours of baking. Namaste makes the BEST GLUTEN FREE FOOD on the market that I've found.  If I had to suggest some food products to someone who was starting the transition from a diet including wheat to a wheat-free diet, I'd recommend Namaste's products.  I've never had a bad product from them.  Try also their pizza crust, spice cake mix, and chocolate cake.  It's all fantastic.

Text: Eases a mother's mind
column5: My 23 month old son was put on a no egg, casein, gluten everything else diet so we can get a clear idea of what he is allergic too.  For those with young ones who are on a similar diet either by necessity or choice know that they can be extremely picky eaters.  I purchased this mix from a health food store just to try it out.  It saved my son's first attended birthday party!  He was perfectly content and didn't pay attention to the fact that others were eating birthday cake.  He loves it!  I put a powdered sugar, vanilla and rice milk glaze on it and cut it into small bites and he calls it candy!  I sincerely applaud the efforts of this company to allow all those who are free to enjoy special treats especially the little guys!  Thank you so much!  (I will be ordering a case of everything eventually :-) )

Text: Best Blondies EVER
column5: Not just "best gluten free" Blondies ever- best Blondies period. I've been gluten free for 30 years, and I have NEVER had a better Blondie. Namaste Blondies have become my favorite treat. In fact, all the Namaste products I have tried taste far superior to anything else on the market that's gluten free.

Text: Love this mix!
column5: I don't have to eat gluten-free but my daughter does and this mix makes the best tasting blondie brownies second only to a Betty Crocker recipe I used to make when I was a teenager back in the 1960s!

Text: Wonderful taste!
column5: I am not a blondie expert by any means, but I sure love them, there is just something about that yummy butterscotch flavor. I have a gluten sensitivity so I avoid it, it really made my day when I discovered these blondies, they taste wonderful and the texture is great too. I like to add chopped walnuts and small chocolate chips. Thanks to Namaste, those who cannot have gluten or other allergens can still enjoy delicious desserts!!

Text: Even if you are not celiac or gluten intolerant
column5: Even if you are not celiac or gluten intolerant, this is very nearly almost eactly like blonde brownies from scratch. Prominent rich butterscotch flavor. In a 13 X 9 pan makes 16 good sized brownies. And they freeze well. I have tried every Namaste product, including the chocolate icing, and they are all excellent products.

Text: The Best Gluten Free Blondies
column5: When I found out I had to go gluten free, the first thing that came to my mind was, "What about Blondies???" My grandmother taught me how to make them 25 years ago. I couldn't imagine never eating them again and I didn't think it would be possible to reproduce them. On a whim, I bought a pack of Namaste Gluten-Free Blondie Mix at my local natural food store. I was delighted to see that one package makes either one 9x13 pan or 2 8x8 pans and that I didn't have to make both 8x8 pans at the same time. The minute I got home, I measured out the ingredients and in 30 minutes (plus cooling time) I had perfect blondies almost exactly like my Grandmother's. My husband loved them even more than Grandma's because they are a bit softer and more cake-like (due to using oil, not butter, I presume.) Two days later, he was asking for more blondies, so I poured the rest of the mix into a bowl and mixed them up. Total disaster. They were wet and under-cooked. I was pretty disappointed. I checked the package to make sure I added the right amount of egg, oil and water. Check. I also had originally scooped out the first batch's dry mix very loosely as the package indicated I should. But it was obvious that the ratio was off. Back to the natural food store- bought two more packages! Today, I got out the digital food scale and weighed the mix. (Make sure you understand how to use the scale- you have to be sure that you are taking into account the weight of the container you are using.) I divided it exactly in half by weight, then measured them out again and was pretty confident I had an exact split. The batch just came out of the oven and is even more perfect than the original one. I am confident the next batch from the same bag will be perfect. ***I added a scant 1/3 cup of very loose dark brown sugar to the mix both times (after weighing) because I knew it wouldn't be sweet enough for my husband. I also added a little extra bit of salt. The first batch I made, I added a splash of good vanilla extract to, but I forgot it this time. I also added 1/3 or so of a package of Ghiradelli 60% Cacao Bittersweet Chocolate baking chips. Ghirardelli 60% Cacao Bittersweet Chocolate Baking Chips, 11.5 oz. Once I test out the second half of this mix successfully, I'll be ordering a case. I am confident I can maintain a gluten-free diet if I can have my favorite snack and these blondies fit the bill.

Text: Blond brownies
column5: I first bought this product as a close-out in a health food store, & have not seen it since.  I was delighted to find it on Amazon, & got a 6 pk.  The day it came I made a batch.  They are VERY good, & for the gluten sensitive, & maybe can't have chocolate, these are just heavenly, & very easy to prepare.  They freeze well (& for the desperate, can be eaten that way too!).  They also cost less buying them this way, as the store price for similar products is over $2 more each.

Text: Way too Good.
column5: These blondies are way way to good.  They are quick and easy to make.  bakes in 30 minutes.  They don't last long in our house.

Text: Soooooo Yummy!!!!!!
column5: Really loved these!! I have 4 small kids and they were so happy to eat these and they taste great for them!! We put craisins in them,,, yummy!!

Text: Excellent Buy
column5: This coffee is an excellent buy.  I only use it for making lattes with my Rancilio Silvia, so I cannot comment on whether the bean makes good drip coffee. As a point of comparison, the beans are way better than Starbucks decaf espresso, and somewhat better than the well-advertised Lavazza beans.  The Coffee Bean Direct beans are not quite as good as Caffe Umbria Mezzanotte Decaf Blend.  Nevertheless, considering the incredible price difference between Coffee Bean Direct and Caffe Umbria, Coffee Bean Direct is a great choice. To be clear, I am not saying that you have to settle on flavor - the coffee is fantastic. Most people who have tried the lattes I make with the Coffee Bean Direct beans with the Silvia and the Rocky grinder cannot believe how great the coffee is or that it is decaf.  Like the other reviewers said, the grind is very important in order to get the great flavor and crema.  So if you are initially disappointed, experiment with your grind, dose, tamp, etc. until you get a great shot. I freeze the beans in air-tight plastic bags, and only take out small amounts of beans at a time.  I remove any air in the bag before returning the bag to the freezer.  If I don't, then the coffee becomes bitter/sour.  I average a couple of lattes a day, and a single bag lasts about 3 months.

Text: Coffee Bean Direct Decaf Espresso Beans
column5: We've started buying this product from Amazon about a year ago and the quality and value is so good that we started a subscription program (bit tricky to determine your needs for the first few months - but you can easily modify this as you learn).  Love this bean - great taste and always fresh - we mix it with a regular espresso bean to cut back on the "jolt" a bit. Highly Recommended!!

Text: Nice, rich flavor
column5: I normally go for medium roasts for espresso since I drink it straight, and the dark roasts tend to have a burnt undertone that can range from unpleasant to downright nasty. This roast from Coffee Bean Direct is the exception, however. The flavor is rich with smokey tones, but no (or very little) burned flavor. Excellent crema as well. While I can't say for sure since I don't like milk in my coffee, I imagine the flavor would stand up very well in a milk-based drink. I did try it as an Americano, and it was quite good. The flavors were toned down a bit as you would expect, but still came through nicely. I did have to fiddle with the grind level a bit to get a decent shot. The setting I use for medium roast beans nearly choked my espresso machine - took nearly 50 seconds for a double shot and, as you can imagine, was quite horrible. I had to go two full notches coarser on my Vario grinder to get a good shot. I expect this is due to the fact that the darker roast is much more oily than the medium roasts, and needs a coarser grind. I do wish it came in a smaller package so it would be easier to store and keep fresh. But, the five pound bag comes at an excellent per-pound price. Good beans at a good price. Highly recommend.

Text: Good Flavor
column5: It's almost as good as caffeinated espresso. Good job on the CO2 process with more flavor than water process. Smokey, slightly sweet, medium/heavy body, low acid. Very oily beans out of the bag with a rich strong smokey aroma. A good espresso bean. It had great crema, so I'm really glad I bought this. Too bad 5 pounds is going to take forever to finish by myself.

Text: Good Coffee
column5: Excellent coffee beans! The beans were fresh and not dried out. Beans have a lot of oil. Taste is smooth. Use it for brewed coffee.  Very nice coffee. Signed up for automatic shipments it is so good.

Text: Best tasting decaf I've had
column5: This is no doubt the best tasting decaf coffee that I've had.  I stopped drinking caffeinated coffee last year and have found it difficult finding good tasting decaf.  (I also try to avoid chemically decaffeinated coffee.)  The selection of decaf coffees is somewhat limited, but more significantly, I find that most decafs just don't taste too good compared to full bodied caffeinated coffees.  This is my first taste of CO2 decaf - I'm not sure what role the process plays, but Coffee Bean Direct got it right.  This coffee is full bodied, rich and great tasting.  I would definitely buy it again.  I only wish it came in a smaller sized bag.

Text: yummy decaf coffee
column5: I really like this decaf espresso! It's tasty, smooth and rich. Since I make it in a regular drip coffee pot (sorry!)and drink it black, these qualities are especially important to me. Plus, it's a great buy. I do wish it were organic. My second five pounds is already on its way!

Text: Rich and aromatic.
column5: I like to blend decaf with regular coffee, but I much prefer to grind the beans prior to brewing.  This decaf is very rich tasting, has a deep roasted flavor without the burned/sour aftertaste (like Starbucks coffee does).  I mix it with Coffee Bean Direct Italian Roast beans.  Good buy!

Text: I really tried
column5: I really tried with this coffee.  I tried it in a coffee maker, then I tried packing it in my espresso machine. Then I tried it in my foolproof french press, all to no avail.  No matter what I did I could not deny that every method yielded the dreaded grainy taste.  The price seemed right and so did the reviews. So Im back to taste testing again, searching for that perfect sip.

Text: Good Decaf
column5: Another good hearty decaf from Coffee Bean Direct.  Exactly what my wife and I like.  The CO2 process seems to work well without removing all the favor.

Text: A good brew for a fair price
column5: Coffee bean direct CO2 coffee provides a good strong cup of decaf coffee, most decaf coffee's are weak or the ones that are espresso roast are expensive. This coffee is reasonably priced and has very good and rich flavor.

Text: It's Sugar
column5: It came all busted up and leaking but I did have it shipped out to Afghanistan to use in my sweet tea maker. It did sweeten the tea though so it did it's job.

Text: still have it
column5: domino sugar is the best i've had in america so far as sugar goes. You dont have to use much sugar for your drink to taste sweet.

Text: Regular Sugar
column5: Sugar arrived on time and had no damage or defects. Bag was still fully sealed and there was no moisture inside. This is just a plain, refined white sugar so there's not too much I can say about it but it does deliver on fulfilling basic sugar needs.

Text: such a nice product
column5: Needed Sugar for cookies I was baking for my family. My Safeway delivery did not include the needed sugar. I was in a bind Thanks to you. I received sugar delivered the next day. Wow what a miracle. On the other hand I need Confectioners.

Text: Hole in the bag
column5: The bag of Domino sugar I ordered came open, and with a small hole in the bottom. The sugar was salvageable, but because the sugar was not properly wrapped or insulated from the rest of my items, the serration from the sugar granules poked holes in the gifts I bought that came in the same box. I would not recommend ordering easily breakable items like this through Amazon- or if you do, keep in mind what you order it with.

Text: Terrible price
column5: Amazon price is currently $11.89, this is much cheaper just about everywhere else by at least 50%. Unfortunately I purchased without researching much, just wanted to warn anyone else considering buying.

Text: Too expensive for me
column5: I cancel this order. Too expensive, opened bag spilled all over-what a mess. Amazon.com said they would send me another one and I'm still waiting.

Text: Great soup base but average noodle
column5: The soup is very good, taste closer to actual thing, the noodle however is pretty average, so I gave 4 star

Text: My Favorite Instant Ramen
column5: I'm a big fan of Japanese culture, especially the food. I found this flavor of instant ramen quite some time ago, but it's still one of my favorites. Back when I discovered it, I only bought one bowl to try and I was instantly hooked! But when I went back to the store to buy it again, they were out of stock, and when I tried looking for it online, it was no where to be found. I'm so excited that it's available online now! It has a great garlic and onion flavor with a delicious sesame aftertaste. It's not spicy at all, which is a great alternative to all those super hot ramen soups. Some people might be put off by some of the ingredients, (look up tonkotsu soup) but it has such an amazing flavor, that it doesn't matter. If you're into trying new things, like Japanese food and love great flavor, definitely try this one.

Text: A pleasant surprise!
column5: These noodles are not spicy at all, but certainly flavorful!  They have a buttery, garlic and onion flavor with a slight undertone of ginger.  My husband even liked it. (He's not a fan of spicy hot dishes nor veggies.)  They're easy to make.  Pull the label open half way, and add the flavor packets found inside.  I add hot water from my coffee maker to the line inside.  Close the label, and let it sit a while to soften the noodles. Done.  I found them at our local Asian grocery store.

Text: Outstanding for instant ramen
column5: I'll preface this review with the clarification that my five star rating is based on my opinions given the nature of the product- as a pre-packaged ramen. It's certainly no substitute for a "real" bowl of tonkotsu ramen. I'm a hardcore Sapporo-style ramen fan but the closest noodle shop with tonkotsu ramen is a bit out of my way and eating there requires some planning. Preparing the soup for homemade tonkotsu ramen is a long process that can take days, depending on the recipe, and I've never been motivated enough to finally try it myself from scratch because the time and effort is just too daunting for me. I dislike prepackaged ramen as a general rule, especially ramen of the "instant" variety that only needs the addition of boiling water and rehydration. I decided to give this product a shot since I've never had a prepackaged ramen that promised the flavor of a tonkotsu broth, which is rich and unctuous, and most instant ramen broths just resemble a clear bouillon. For a prepackaged instant ramen, I have to say that I'm really impressed with how well the flavors and texture of "real" tonkotsu broth are represented. No, I'd never mistake it for the real thing and if it were the real thing then I'd consider it below mediocre but for what it is, I consider it outstanding and I'll be re-ordering. Note: This is very salty (1680 mg sodium), heavy (21 g fat) and more caloric (410 calories) than most prepackaged ramen, which is already considered to be bad for you, but that's true of many "real" tonkotsu broths and as an occasional lunch while I'm at at work and stuck at my desk, I'm okay with that and adjust the rest of my foods that day accordingly. I wouldn't be willing to waste my sodium, fat or calorie budgets on any other instant ramen I've ever had.

Text: Stock your pantry w/Menraku "Tonkotsu" Ramen!!!
column5: **BEGIN UPDATE 9/08** Just received my 2nd case of 12 in a little over 3-wks, but then again I've been sharing, 1/3 for sharing w/my taste-buddies while the remaining 2/3's have been for my own taste-buds.  I added little steamed won-tons today but it was more than this soup needed, maybe tomorrow a sliced hard-boiled egg; keeping it simple is the best way to enjoy this bowl of ramen wherein the broth is superior. I will let you know if I ever get on to trying the other flavors as I'd originally hoped.  Thanks for reading. **END UPDATE** If you ever enjoyed add-hot water and wait bowl-type instant ramen, this has, in my humble opinion, the best tasting broth, no-contest of this type that I've ever had since "Cup Jorick" came along early 70's. Fast-forward, for the last year or so I've enjoyed the "Nong Shim Big Bowl Noodle Udon" (still do!) since it isn't SPICY at all, allowing me to add spice if I choose to change it up, add steamed won-tons, char siu - you get the idea.  "Menraku Tonkotsu Ramen" while the noodles are on par w/instant ramen of the bowl variety, here it's the RICH BROTH, that immediately upon tasting, is set apart from the usual within the category.  Other reviewers here who have also enjoyed have picked up the same flavorful aspects:  buttery, a bit of garlic, a rich-tasting broth like you could only get home-made or in the best kept secret asian restaurants.  I look forward to trying the other Menraku varieties:  Shio Ramen, Miso Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen, all very basic flavors that can be lost causes in the wrong hands but I am convinced on this experience alone, though "Tonkotsu" ramen may be my new, all-time favorite, that I will enjoy the others as well.  Wondered about "Tonkotsu"(pork-bone), not to be confused w/"tonkatsu"(breaded pork cutlet), as the broth didn't convey much pork taste though it could be usual Japanese subtlety at play here.  I got this on WED and I've had one each day since.  I should get another case soon as I know I'll be sharing.  Currently living in a dorm?  Buy the case. Stash it however you're best  able or split the case w/others. It's quick, easy and great value.  Amazon Prime got it here in two-days!!!  The only thing left to say is "Itadakimasu!"

Text: Did not get my thing at all
column5: I did NOT get my paid thing, and I can NOT track my package at all. I don't care who is in charge of missing package. Really freaks me out for cannot get the food that I had already paid for.

Text: Bully Springs
column5: These are excellent Bully Springs but one of them was too big for my small yorkie to chew so I gave it to the neighbors larger dog.  He was able to chew the skinnier one and he seemed to enjoy it.  I do wish that these came in skinnier, easy to chew for smaller dogs.  I never know when I place an order what I'm going to get.  I'm going to keep looking but I highly recommend for larger dogs.

Text: Good tea, but better in the satchel
column5: I first had this tea in the satchel.  It is fantastic that way.  When I finished my firs tin I saw that it came in bags and a box as an option as well.  I ordered the fifty pack.  The bags are good and very convenient when I travel, but no match for the satchels in flavor.  If you like a touch of cinnamon, the bags are fine.  If you want a more robust taste, I recommend the satchel.

Text: hot cinnamon wake-up
column5: This is an excellent spiced tea blend for anyone with a passion for cinnamon.  Works well both with and without cream.

Text: Simply the best bar none
column5: I have tried other cinnamon teas and they either taste like alfalfa or extremely weak. Harney's cinnamon tea is just great.

Text: Delicious! must have an allergy to something though
column5: This tea is absolutely delicious and I love that it is sweet without any additional sugar! It is very spicy as well. The tea is great as-is or with a bit of milk. Unfortunately twice when I've had this tea, part of my face has become bright red, tight, and itchy. It goes down after 20 minutes or so. I must be allergic to something in the tea. Take a good look at the ingredients before buying!

Text: World's best tea!
column5: If you love cinnimon, this is your tea.  The flavor is is out of this world.

Text: Most flavorful tea
column5: I first had this tea at a Starbucks & then ordered it for use at home. I love the strong flavors and have made it my routine hot drink. I will continue to order online as I have had prompt delivery without any problems with the product. I would recommend this tea to anyone who likes a strong, cinnamon/spice tea that is just perfect as it is no cream or sugar needed.Harney & Sons Fine Teas Hot Cinnamon Spice - 50 Tea bags

Text: Great Aroma
column5: Hands down the best tea I've ever had. The aroma is enticing; full flavor delivers. Delicious. I will order again.

Text: CINN-A-MON!  Second to NONE!
column5: Now how can you add anything to the excellent reviews the excellent people here wrote?  (I feel for the one here that had the allergic response to it). So, if you really like cinnamon, (that be me), you can't do better than this for flavor, unless you chew it off the tree.  Good luck with that one.  I'm not much of a hot tea drinker except in winter.  So this summer, I made a gallon of sun tea with this and I-am-now-addicted! I use 8 or 9 bags per gallon.  If the sachets, then 6 or 7.  I like my tea strong so I leave the bottle out for as long as it takes me to remember I put it out there.  No bitterness at all.  I can always dilute the mixture if I have to.  But that's what ice cubes give up their lives for.  I'll never go back to orange pekoe again.  Take THAT, Lipton!

Text: Cinnamon Teabags
column5: Awesome tea, arrived VERY fast.  Although it is "hot" cinnamon, it is not like fireballs or redhots; it is actually a much milder cinnamon taste than I expected, but very very good.

Text: Hot and Soothing
column5: If you liked Cinnamon Tic Tacs (no longer made), you will love this tea!  This is a flavorable tea that has a robust (but not too bold) taste.  I like drinking this tea after meals, like a soothing dessert.  I already ordered more as this has become a daily drink!!

Text: AMAZINGLY good tea!!!!!
column5: This is AMAZING tea.  It is very cinnamon-y and spicy, but it is also sweet, not bitter at all.  Really outstanding tea.  I work at a school and have shared tea bags with lots of other teachers, and they all love it too - rave reviews from everyone who's tried it.  This is my all-time favorite tea.  Good any time of day.  Good hot or cold.  Good brewed weak or strong.  Worth every penny.  And the delivery was outstanding too.  I 've ordered it twice and it arrived really fast both times.  Super happy customer (and that's sayin' something, because I can be darn cranky about things).  :)

Text: Best cinnamon tea
column5: Just as all the reviews said, this tea is delicious. I am hooked on the strong, sweet cinnamon. I drink it everyday; I don't ever want to run out of it. I'm ordering my third box and am recommending it to my friends.

Text: Amazing
column5: It's hard to get excited about tea, but this blend is amazing.  This tea has a smooth, rich, powerful flavor. When you open the package and the aroma hits your olfactory, you know you're in for a treat.  You won't be disappointed with this unless you dislike cinnamon.

Text: Awesome, Flavorful Tea!
column5: I absolutely LOVE this tea. The first time I had it was when I had a wonderful meal at Ruth Chris Steak House and they served it to me there. I was so entranced by it,I asked the waitress where they bought it. Not only did she tell me, she also gave me four tea bags to take home! Needless to say, I've been hooked since then. This tea is just sweet and spicy enough to be absolutely satisfying. It tastes remarkably like the red hot cinnamon candy - which if you had asked me beforehand if I would like, I would have said no. But it's just the right blend to make it perfect. Another reason I love it is because it satisfies my sweets craving without actually  having to have sweets. Who wouldn't love a nice zero-calorie tea that tastes just as good as the candy? Try it for yourself - you will love it!

Text: I feel so fancy drinking this
column5: I am addicted to caffeine. If there were street pushers in shady parts of town selling it, I would be there looking for my fix. Thankfully, it is a legal stimulant and Amazon is my dealer.  Hot Cinnamon Spice is not so much a radical break from my normal coffee and tea habits, it is more of a revelation that I can get a heck of a flavor along with that sweet caffeine hit.  It has a fairly strong cinnamon smell, but the flavor is neither overpowering nor "hot" as the name may say. I would recommend drinking without adding any sugar, milk or cream to it, as it is sweet in it's natural state and this is a flavor that should not be drowned out. That, and milk is disgusting.  After I made a cup at work, the vultures started circling wondering what the wonderful aroma was. 50 bags seemed silly to purchase, but with by freeloader coworkers they will be gone in no time.  I give it two snaps up.

Text: Heavenly
column5: Hands down most delicious tea I have ever had. In fact it tastes so decadent it doesn't even taste like tea. With a little stevia and almond milk I feel like I'm drinking a delicious dessert! (Although I only drink it in the morning/ before 3pm since it does back quite a caffeinated kick!

Text: tastes like a red hot
column5: I love this tea - to me it tastes like drinking a red hot cinnamon hard candy I used to love when i was a kid.  if you like sweet cinnamon you will love this tea!

Text: Total Cinnamon World
column5: Wow this is really spicy and cinnamony (if that is a word). A bargain really considering that you get 50 large bags in a box. I would advise that this tea tastes quite sweet to me without any added ingredients out of the box. So go careful on sugar. May I suggest pairing this with the wonderful organic agave cinnamon sweetner available through Amazon as a compliment. (ASIN: B0048INV38). This makes it a cinnabomb.

Text: Better than the original "spice" tea
column5: I've tried two different brands of cinnamon spice tea, and even though this is most likely derivative of the first brand, Harney & Sons' version is so much better. It isn't quite as bitter and the cinnamon gives you a more rounded taste, instead of being overpowering. The scent is intoxicating, and the tea tastes naturally sweet - its great for a cold day!

Text: DELICIOUS!
